definition.value:
--Name--
Reference parcel

-- Definition --
Means a geographically delimited area retaining a unique identification as registered in the LPIS. a.k.a. identification system for agricultural parcels referred to in Article 70 of Regulation (EU) No 1306/2013. 

-- Description --
Basic spatial unit for the administration and geographical localization of agricultural parcels. May contain one or more declared agricultural parcels in IACS and may be cultivated by one or more farmers (or producers association). Does not necessarily cover a territory nationwide, but overlaps are not allowed. 

NOTE.  Definition in the past. Reference parcel - a continuous area of agricultural land (production block) grouping together a number of neighboring agricultural parcels (production units) cultivated by one or more farmer(s) and delineated by most stable boundaries. Subtypes (used in the past): CadParcel, AgrParcel, FarBlock, PhyBlock, TopoBlock and MixedParcelType. It current model it is not implemented, since these concepts are not core elements of current IACS model.

-- Name--
Status value

--Definition --
Code list of possible status values.

-- Description --
List of status types based on state machine diagrams (Dynamic CAP model) for new and existing object features or schema. The values included in this code list are applicable both to introduction of a new object/feature or to processing a change request.

NOTE. These are generic values applicable in IACS. These concepts have been reused in LPIS upgrade and LPIS update processes.

--Name--
Archived

--Definition--
Status of an object according to the state machine diagram.

-- Description--
Final state of an object after its depreciation (retirement).
Such object is no more in use; its life cycle has been completed.

NOTE 1. FeatureLevelMetadata.endLifespanVersion<>Null

NOTE 2. NOTE 2: If applied, FeatureLevelMetadata.validTo<>Null

-- Name--
In progress

--Definition--
Status of an object according to the state machine diagram.

-- Description --
The value shall be assigned when processing of the issue/anomaly has been started. The value is applicable to
- the issue/anomaly that reported the change request
- the object (schema element or data) that is subject of the change request.

EXAMPLE 1. Schema element objects are:
- the entire application schema,
- feature and data types
- attributes, association roles,
- constraints
- value types (etc).

EXAMPLE 2. Data objects are specific instances of a feature or data types (e.g. RP, farmer, anomaly, payment. The change may be applied to 
- the instance as a whole (depreciation of an obsolete instance or introduction of a new instance),
- a specific value (attribute) of an instance.

NOTE: Rules for depreciation are defined by internal business rules of the MS/Region

-- Name--
Valid

--Definition--
Status of an object according to the state machine diagram.

-- Description --
The most current state of the object that shall be used by the users. 

NOTE 1: It is a current object whose life-cycle has not ended.
FeatureLevelMetadata.endLifespanVersion=Null

NOTE 2: If applied, FeatureLevelMetadata.validTo=Null

-- Name--
Under cross-check

--Definition--
Status of an object according to the state machine diagram.

-- Description --
Whenever a transaction in the information system is performed, the system shall be checked for integrity of the schema and the consistency of data. 

NOTE 1. Cross checks are also the tools to find further issues/anomalies. When a new upgrade issue/anomaly is found, the "open" value shall be assigned and the full life cycle assessment of the object has to be performed.

-- Name--
Under evaluation

--Definition--
Status of an object according to the state machine diagram.

-- Description --
Preliminary assessment about the impact of the Upgrade issue or the anomaly. This value should be assigned in the phase when
- supporting evidences are collected  and/or
- checks for issue/anomaly duplicates are performed.  
The assessment may conclude that no modification to the existing data is needed, or that the reported change request has to be further processed.

--Name--
Open

--Definition--
Status of an object according to the state machine diagram.

--Description --
This status is applicable to UpgradeIssue and Anomaly feature types only. The value is assigned in the moment when an instance of these feature types is introduced in the information system.

-- Definition --
Approved,

--Definition--
Status of an object according to the state machine diagram.

-- Description --
Status of the targeted schema / data object after final controls (consistency with IACS  and local rules).

-- Name--
Rejected

--Definition--
Status of an object according to the state machine diagram.

-- Description --
Status of the change request after the negative outcome of the preliminary evaluation or the cross-check. It also means that no modification to the existing information can be executed.

NOTE: For transparency, the rejected change requests shall be archived.

-- Name--
Under approval

--Definition--
Status of an object according to the state machine diagram.

-- Description --
Based on the outcome of cross checks the change request is approved. The object is waiting for finalisation.

-- Definition --
Legal person.
-- Description --
NOTE. Third party class of a single system to record the identity of each legal person.

--Name--
Critical defect

-- Definition --
Critical defect is a non-conformance  that obstructs the use of the item under inspection regarding the unambiguous localization of agricultural parcels, or the unique identification for cross-checks (Wikicap).

-- Description --
The usability of the RP can be obstructed by misclassification of the LC (no agricultural land present in the RP), by violating the design (semantic definition) if the LPIS or by processing errors within LPIS.

-- Definition --
Site within holding.
-- Description --
All land  at a same or distinct geographic location under the management control of a holding covering activities, products and services. This includes all infrastructure, equipment and materials. The geometry of the site  must be a point or a surface. 
NOTE. The  site can be represented by a point or by a surface. The site can have only one geometry. Mulitpoint or multisurface is not allowed.

--Name--
EFA critical defect type

-- Definition --
This is a placeholder only; currently not to be implemented.

-- Description --
List of error types leading to obstruction of usability of the item under inspection (critical defect).

--Name--
Invalid weighting parameter

-- Definition --
This is a placeholder only; currently not to be implemented.

-- Description --
Error in selecting the weighting parameter.

--Name--
Invalid conversion parameter

-- Definition --
This is a placeholder only; currently not to be implemented.

-- Description --
Error in selection of the conversion parameter.

--Name--
Not connected to arable land

-- Definition --
This is a placeholder only; currently not to be implemented.

--Description --
Not connected to arable land.

--Name--
Total absence of eligible types

-- Definition --
This is a placeholder only; currently not to be implemented.

-- Description --
Total absence of eligible types.

--Name--
Invalid geometry

-- Definition --
This is a placeholder only; currently not to be implemented.

-- Description --
Other geometry than the choice of the MS/Region has been used.

--Name--
Landscape feature

-- Definition--
Elements of the agricultural area that are traditionally part of good agriculture cropping or utilization practices [Regulation (EU) 640/2014 Art. 9(1)].

-- Description --
Any landscape feature subject to the requirements and standards listed in Annex II to Regulation (EU) No 1306/2013 which forms part of the total area of an agricultural parcel shall be considered part of the eligible area.

--Name--
Data quality measure types applicable for ETS sample

-- Definition --
Data quality measures applicable for LPIS quality assessment process at sample level.

--Description--
By exclusion of misclassification  matrix the elements of the code list are user defined data quality measures to assess quality of the ETS sample. Misclassification matrix comes directly from ISO 19157:2013.

label.en: DTS data quality measure type list

definition.value:
--Name--
Number of critical defects

-- Definition --
Number of all critical defects (M) found in course of inspection.

--Description --
The scope of this data quality measure is the critical defect property (instances of critical defects) occurring  in course of inspection,

Measure identifier: L_NCD
Name: LPIS number of critical defects
Alias: LPIS critical defects
Element name: Conceptual consistency
Basic measure: Error count
Value type: Number
Value Structure: n.a.

NOTE. Previously named as 10205 LPIS_RP_CRA

--Name--
Number of large area non-conformities

-- Definition --
Number of non-conforming inspected items (N2) with area >0,1 ha within the ETS sample.

-- Description --
Count of items with itemConformance (area)=FALSE value. 
  
Measure identifier: L_NANC_B
Name: Number of area non-conforming items
Alias: Item area non conformity number
Element name: Conceptual consistency
Basic measure: Error count
Value type: Number
Value Structure: n.a.

labels.en: Number of area >0,1 ha non-conforming items

definition.value:
--Name--
LPIS area accuracy conformance

-- Definition --
Assessment of correct quantification of the maximum eligible area according to EU 640/2014 Art. 6.1(a). 

-- Description --
Conformance statement on area quantification. The threshold is +/- 2%.

Measure identifier: L_RACON
Name: LPIS area accuracy correctness
Alias: QE1 conformance
Element name: Conceptual consistency
Basic measure: Error indicator
Value type: Boolean
Value Structure: n.a.

NOTE. Previously named: QE 1A

--Name--
LPIS item conformnace

-- Definition --
Achievement of the value of the acceptance number prescribed for the area based quality measures.

-- Description --
Conformance statement whether the number of non-conforming item has exceeded the acceptance number.
  
Measure identifier: L_ICON
Name: LPIS item conformance
Alias: QE2a
Element name: Conceptual consistency
Basic measure: Error indicator
Value type: Boolean
Value Structure: n.a.

NOTE. Previously known as number of non-conforming reference parcels in LPIS, or 10202 LPIS_RP_NEA

--Name--
LPIS area overestimates

-- Definition --
One-sided probability boundary of the rate of the eligible hectares that indicate overestimations found in respect to the total number of eligible hectares currently recorded in the LPIS.

--Description --
Technical definition: Lower Interval Boundary (LIB)
Calculation method: LIB=OER-1,6449xOERxstdev(OER)

Measure identifier: L_AOE
Name: LPIS area overestimates
Alias: LPIS lower interval boundary
Element name: Quantitative attribute accuracy
Basic measure: LE 98
Value type: Measure
Value Structure: n.a.

NOTE. Previously it was known as part of 10201_2 LPIS_RP_MEA_B

--Name--
LPIS area underestimates

-- Definition --
One-sided probability boundary of the rate if the eligible hectares that indicate underestimation found in respect to the total number of eligible hectares currently recorded in the LPIS . 

-- Description --
Technical definition: Upper Interval Boundary
Calculation method: UIB=UER-1,6449xUERxstdev(UER)

Measure identifier: L_AUE
Name: LPIS area underestimates
Alias: LPIS upper interval boundary
Element name: Quantitative attribute accuracy
Definition: LE98
Value type: Measure
Value Structure: n.a.

NOTE. Previously named as 10201_2 LPIS_RP_MEA_B

--Name--
Number of area non-conformities

-- Definition --
Number of area non-conforming inspected items (N1) within the ETS sample.

-- Description --
Count of items with itemConformance (area)=FALSE value.  

Measure identifier: L_NANC_A
Name: Number of area non-conforming items
Alias: Item area non conformity number
Element name: Conceptual consistency
Basic measure: Error count
Value type: Number
Value Structure: n.a.

--Name--
Cumulative rate of missed updates

-- Definition --
Rate of undetected anomalies (changes of the land) since the last update of LPIS.

-- Description --
Ratio of the abundance of missedUpdates to the number of inspected items calculated for each year and summed up starting from the year of last update (refresh).

Measure identifier: L_CRMU
Name: Cumulative rate of missed updates
Alias:  Missed updated accumulation
Element name: Non-quantitative attribute correctness
Basic measure: Error rate
Value type: Real. The value shall be expressed in %.
Value Structure: n.a.

NOTE. Previouslynamed QE6, 10207 LPIS_RP_CMC

--Name--
Conformity to class 1

-- Definition --
Conformance class as defined in Article 6 (1) of EU 640/2014.

-- Description --
It is the aggregated quality measure of the conformance results of QE1, QE2, and QE3.  In order to pass, each composing element shall be conforming.

Measure identifier: L_CLASS1
Name: Conformity with class 1
Alias: First conformance class
Element name: Conceptual consistency
Basic measure: Error indicator
Value type: Boolean
Value Structure: n.a.

--Name--
Conformity to class 2

-- Definition --
Conformance class as defined in Article 6 (1) of EU 640/2014.

-- Description --
It is the aggregated quality measure of the conformance results of QE4, QE5 and QE6.  In order to pass, each composing element must pass the test.
Since at the moment no conformance for QE4 and QE5 are defined, the value of this element coincides with the values of QE6.

Measure identifier: L_CLASS2
Name: Conformity with class 2
Alias: Second conformance class
Element name: Conceptual consistency
Basic measure: Error indicator
Value type: Boolean
Value Structure: n.a.

--Name--
Area correctness distribution

-- Definition --
Statistical distribution of relative area correctness values.

-- Description --
The population of relativeAreaCorrectness values defined for the following intervals: 
- [-50%,<], (-50,-20%], (-20,-12%], (-12,-8%;], (-8,-4%,], (-4,-2%],  (-2, 0%], (0, 2%], (2, 4%], (4, 8%], (8, 12%], (12, 20%], (20, 50%], (<50%]

Measure identifier: L_ACD
Name: Area correctness distribution
Alias: QE2b
Element name: Relatives or internal accuracy
Value type: Measure
Value Structure: sequence (table)

NOTE 1: Previously named as  10203 LPIS_RP_SEA

NOTE 2: DQM_Measure.DQM_ValueStructure=Sequence (previously was Table).

--Name--
LPIS area precision conformance

-- Definition --
Assessment of the severity of area under-and overestimates as required by Eu 640/2014 Art. 6.1(b).

-- Description --
Conformance statement on the severity of area under and overestimates.
Conformity thresholds: LIB>=-2%, UIB<=2%.

Measure identifier: L_APCON
Name: LPIS area precision conformance
Alias:  LPIS area over- and underestimate conformance
Element name: Conceptual consistency
Basic measure: Error indicator
Value type: Boolean
Value Structure: n.a.

NOTE. Previously known as part of QE1B or 10201_2 LPIS_RP_MEA_B

--Name--
LPIS critical defect conformance

-- Definition --
Achievement of the acceptance number prescribed for critical defects for the given lot. 

-- Description --
For conformance the number of critical defects shall not exceed the value of criticalDefectAcceptanceNumber selected in function of the lot size and LQ=2,0.

Measure identifier: L_CDCON
Name: LPIS critical defect conformance
Alias: QE3
Element name: Conceptual consistency
Basic measure: Error indicator
Value type: Boolean
Value Structure: n.a.

NOTE. Previously named QE4,10205 LPIS_RP_CRA.

--Name--
Misclassification matrix

-- Definition --
Misclassification matrix comparing the assignment of LC types registered in LPIS to the LC types observed in course of inspection.

-- Description --
All land cover types (both agricultural land and landscape feature) enter in the evaluation process. 

Measure identifier: L_MCM
Name: LPIS misclassification matrix
Alias: LC confusion matrix
Element name: Classification correctness
Basic measure: n.a.
Value type: Measure
Value Structure:  Matrix

NOTE 1: Classifying one pro-rata grassland type to another pro-rata class is considered as a misclassification instance.

NOTE 2: This is an indicative measure for self-evaluation, which is not required by regulation EU 640/2014.

NOTE 3: This is a DQM directly taken from IOS 19157:2013 (see table D.65).

--Name--
LPIS relative area correctness

--Definition --
Ratio of the total observed area in course of ETS to the sum of reference area of the corresponding parcels.

-- Description --
Measure identifier: L_RAC
Name: LPIS relative area correctness
Alias: LPIS maximum eligible area correctness
Element name: Relative or internal accuracy
Basic measure: Error rate
Value type: Measure. The ratio shall be expressed in percentages.
Value Structure: n.a.

NOTE. Previously named: 10201 LPIS_RP_MEA

-- Definition --
Farmer.
-- Description --
Farmer is natural or legal person, or a group of natural or legal persons, regardless of the legal status granted to such group and its members by national law, whose holding is situated within the territorial scope of the Treaties, as defined in Article 52 TEU in conjunction with Articles 349 and 355 TFEU, and who exercises an agricultural activity. 1307/2013 4 (1)(a).
NOTE. Main class of a single system to record the identity of each beneficiary of the support referred to in Article 67(2) who submits an aid application or a payment claim.

-- Definition --
Holding
-- Description --
The holding is whole area and all infrastructures included on it, covering the same or different  "sites", under the control  of an operator to perform agricultural or aquaculture activities. 
The units (sites within holding) used for agricultural activities and managed by a farmer situated within the territory of the same Member State. 1307/2013 4(1)(b). Where an agricultural area of a holding is also used for non-agricultural activities, that area shall be considered to be used predominantly for agricultural activities provided that those agricultural activities can be exercised without being significantly hampered by the intensity, nature, duration and timing of the non-agricultural activities 1307/2013 32(3)(a). The total area of the holding consists of the utilised agricultural area (arable land, permanent grassland, permanent crops and kitchen gardens) and other land (unutilised agricultural land, wooded area and other land).

--Name--
Upgrade issue

-- Definition --
Change request targeted at the conceptual model.

-- Description --
The change request may target the application schema of the LCM or the eligibility profile of the MS/Region.

--Name--
Skipping reason value type

-- Definition --
List  of reasons that do not allow the inspection of a given item under inspection.

-- Description --
Objective reasons for skipping  an item under inspection.

NOTE: This code list is managed by DG JRC. MS/Regions are not allowed to extend it.

--Name--
Inspected in aggregation

-- Definition --
Parcel already Inspected as part of an aggregation item.

-- Description --
If pre selected parcel has previously entered in to an aggregation then this parcel shall not be inspected again.

NOTE. This value is applicable if only the parcel aggregation method has been adapted.

--Name--
Insufficient image quality

-- Definition --
Insufficient image quality obstructing the process of inspection bz the method of CAPI.

-- Description --
Interpretation of the inspected item is not possible with the given orthoimagery.

NOTE 1: When an MS/Region opts for pure field observations and measurements, this reason is incompatible with the this method. Therefore this value should be deleted from the eligibility profile.

NOTE 2: In DTS 5.3 the value wasluiInterpretationImpossibleWithGivenOrthoimageC4. The corresponding coded value was C4.

--Name--
Clouds or haze

-- Definition --
Insufficient image quality due to meteorological conditions.

-- Description --
Parcel partially or fully covered by clouds or haze.

NOTE 1: When an MS/Region opts for pure field observations and measurements, this reason is incompatible with the this method. Therefore this value should be deleted from the eligibility profile.

NOTE 2: In DTS 5.3 the  value was: parcelIsPartiallyOrFullyCoveredByCloudsOrHaze. The coresponding recommended coded value was T4.

NOTE 3: With the introduction of dedicated LPIS QA image acquisition, applicability should become rare.

--Name--
Missing image coverage

-- Definition --
Incomplete othroimagery coverage.

-- Description --
Parcel is partially or full not covered by orhtoimagery.

NOTE 1: When an MS/Region opts for pure field observations and measurements, this reason is incompatible with the this method. Therefore this value should be deleted from the eligibility profile.

NOTE 2: In DTS 5.3 the  value was: parcelIsPartiallyOrFullyNotCoveredByImage. The coresponding recommended coded value was T2.

NOTE 3: With the introduction of dedicated LPIS QA image acquisition, applicability should become rare.

--Name--
Missing geometry

-- Definition --
Incomplete vector dataset that obstructs the inspection process.

-- Description --
Geometric representation of the item under is not available.

NOTE: In DTS 5.3 the  value was: parcelGeometryIsNotAvailable. The coresponding
recommended coded value was T5.

--Name--
Force majeure

-- Definition --
Failure to inspect the item of inspection due to force majeure circumstances observed on the item of inspection. 

-- Description --
EXAMPLES of force majeure: flood,  snow cover, fires, landslides, other natural hazards.

NOTE: In DTS 5.3 the  value was forceMajeureCircumstancesObservedOnLuiF1. The coresponding coded value was F1.

--Name--
Error in scope

-- Definition --
Systematic error in the scope of the population that has not been discovered at the moment of submitting the LPIS population for sampling.

-- Description --
The population submitted is complete, but it contains extra parcels that are not subject to inspection due to an erroneous query that can be easily reproduced/verified.

NOTE: In DTS 5.3 the value was erroneousScopingS1. The corresponding coded value was S1.

labels.en: Extra parcel due to error in the scope

definition.value:
--Name--
Not persistent identifier

-- Definition --
Unambiguous  identification of the item of inspection is impossible due to the discrepancy between the position of the reference parcel feature type and the reality observed on the imagery or terrain.

-- Description --
This problem is caused by re-using identifiers due to the unclear life cycle rules  of the feature type corresponding to the item under inspection (e.g. reference parcel). Transaction  like merging, splitting, or incorporating new agricultural land in an existing RP.

NOTE 1: It is recommended to assign a new unique identifier whenever  a major transaction takes place.

NOTE 2: In DTS 5.3 the  value was: referenceParcelIdFoundNotPersistentInLpisA3. The coresponding recommended coded value was A3.

-- Definition --
Entitlement obtain origin values.
-- Description --
List of possible entitlement obtain sources.

-- Definition --
Lease.
-- Description --
Item description.
NOTE 1. Item note.
EXAMPLE 1. Item example.

-- Definition --

-- Description --

NOTE 1. Item note.
EXAMPLE 1. Item example.

-- Definition --

-- Description --
Item description.
NOTE 1. Item note.
EXAMPLE 1. Item example.

-- Definition --
Notification document template.
-- Description --
Notification document templates used for creation of Notification.

--Name--
Ecological Focus Area

-- Definition --
Ecological focus areas as referred to in Article 46 of R (EU) No1307/2013 and its Delegated Regulation (EU) No 639/2014.

-- Description --
Areas contributing to practices beneficial for the climate and the environment as referred to in Art. 43(2)(c) of (EU) R No 1307/2013.

NOTE 1: This is the feature type that allows the creation of the EFA layer in sense of Art. 70(2) of (EU) R 1306/2013. 

NOTE 2: All instances of potential EFA that remain in place at least for 3 years shall be included [DSCG/2014/31]..

NOTE 3: „Potentiality“ means implies that any EFA situated on holdings of farmers who are exempted (small farmers, organic farming) are is also subject of data collection (mapping) [DSCG/2014/31].

NOTE 4: When an EFA instance (without altering the geometry ) that has been declared for three consecutive year with geospatial application, it should be regarded as permanent, thus within the scope of LPIS.

NOTE 5: EFA instances established under equivalent agri-environmental-climate measures (AECM) are expected to last at least 5 years, therefore they should be regarded to be in scope of LPIS [DSCG/2014/31].

--Name--
Conformance level value

-- Definition --
List of conformance level values.

-- Description --
List of conformance level values. Any product claiming conformance with one of these levels shall pass all requirements described in the corresponding abstract test suite.

NOTE. Requirements of a higher level contain all requirements of a lower level.

--Name--
Level 2

--Definition--
Lowest level conformance.

--Description--
A separate abstract test suite must be provided if a level is defined within ConformanceClause.

--Name--
Level 3

--Definition--
Highest level conformance.

--Description--
A separate abstract test suite must be provided if a level is defined within ConformanceClause.

--Name--
Level 1

--Definition--
Lowest level conformance.

--Description--
A separate abstract test suite must be provided if a level is defined within ConformanceClause.

-- Definition --
Cross-compliance data.
-- Description --
Cross-compliance data.

--Name--
MTS item under inspection

-- Definition--
Eligibility profile or their elements presented as System under Test (SUT) for conformance testing. [Adapted from ISO 19105:2000].

-- Description --
As first step of LPISQA, the Model Test Suit (MTS ) of the eligibility profile has to be performed to assess conformance with the LCM. The initial MTS shall be run on the whole eligibility profile. When a specific element of the eligibility profile is upgraded, partial MTS can be performed following the ETS test cases that are relevant to that element.

Risk type value

Preamble (33) of R (EU) 809/2014 requires that the competent authority should establish the risk factors targeting the areas where the risk of errors is the highest.

NOTE
Risk criteria should be assessed and updated on an annual basis taking into account the relevance of each risk criterion, comparing the results of randomly and risk-based selected samples, the specific situation in the Member States and the nature of the non-compliance.

Areas of Intensive LC or LU change

Areas of intensive land cover and land use change may be detected in third party data e.g.
	- orthoimagery
	- cadastral maps
	- road maps
	- topographic maps
	- development plans

Non-participation in certification scheme

At risk based sampling MS may consider beneficiary’s participation in a certification system if the scheme in question is relevant for the requirements and standards concerned [Art. 69(1)(b) of R 809/2014].

Eligibility Criteria

Member States are also authorised to draw the control sample on the basis of the samples of beneficiaries that are selected for an on-the-spot check as regards eligibility criteria. [Preamble (71) of R 809/2014].

Non participation in FAS

Sampling of OTSC for cross-compliance can be improved by taking into account the risk analysis concerning the beneficiary’s participation in the farm advisory system [Preamble (69) and Art. 69(1)(a) of R 809/2014].

--Name--
EFA equivalent practice type

-- Definition --
Equivalent practices with EFAs which are listed  in print III of Annex IX of Regulation (EU) No 1307/2013.

-- Description --
The specific AECM reason has to be linked to the EFA type.

definition.value:
Sampling stratum

The control sample in respect of the on-the-spot checks of the area-related aid schemes should be made on the basis of a stratified sampling method in order to keep the administrative burden in proportion and the number of beneficiaries to be checked on-the-spot to a reasonable level [Preamble (30) of R  (EU) No 809/2014].

NOTE 1
Sampling stratum can be applied both to random and risk based sampling.

NOTE 2
Control zones for CwRS can be regarded as strata (data clusters) based on geographic location. Such zones can be selected randomly or based on risk analysis.

NOTE 3
A sample may consist of one (unique) or more stratum.

comment.en: A TIN (triangulated irregular network) is a PolyhedralSurface consisting only of Triangle patches.

definition.value:
-- Definition --
List of vegetable and agricultural plant species (aggregate of a varieties). 
-- Description --
A culture of any of the different genera defined in the botanical classification of crops. In this case code list consist of binomial names of species from the taxonomy of Linnaeus (classification for plants).
NOTE. Common catalogue of varieties of agricultural plant species. Fifth supplement to the 29th complete edition (2011/C 168 A/01)
List of agricultural species -A
I. Beet
II. Fodder plants
III. Oil and fibre plants    
IV. Cereals
V. Potatoes 
NOTE. Common catalogue of varieties of vegetable species. 32nd complete edition (2013/C 312 A/01)
List of vegetable species - H

label.en: List of vegetable and agricultural plant species

definition.value:
--Name--
Landscape feature value type

-- Definition --
Types of landscape features.

-- Description --
MS shall decide that one or more values of this code list  are considered to be landscape feature. The code list can be extended.

--Name--
Trees in line

-- Definition --
Trees in line in the agricultural area that are traditionally part of good agriculture cropping or utilization practices 

-- Description --
They may become an EFA element when the crown diameter is minimum 4 meters. The space between the crowns shall not exceed 5 meters. [Art. 45(3)(c) of (EU) R No  639/2014].

NOTE 1: Member States may include trees recognised by them as valuable landscape features with a crown diameter below 4 meters.

NOTE 2: When this type of LF is protected under GAEC 7, SMR 3, MS may specify other width based on national requirements..

--Name--
Group of trees

-- Definition --
Group of trees in the agricultural area that is traditionally part of good agriculture cropping or utilization practices 

-- Description --
Group of trees may become an EFA element where trees are connected by overlapping crown cover, and field copses of maximum 0.3 ha in both cases. [Art. 45(3)(d) of (EU) R No 639/2014].

labels.en: Landscape feature, group of trees/Field copses

definition.value:
--Name--
Ditches

-- Definition --
Ditches in the agricultural area that are traditionally part of good agriculture cropping or utilization practices.

-- Description --
Ditches may become an EFA element when their width does not exceeds 6 meters. Ditches also include open watercourses for the purpose of irrigation or drainage. Channels with walls of concrete shall not be considered ecological focus area. [Art. 45(3)(g) of (EU) R No  639/2014].

NOTE : When this type of LF is protected under SMR 3, MS may specify other width based on  national requirements.

---Name--
Traditional stone walls

-- Definition --
Traditional stone walls in the agricultural area that are part of good agriculture cropping or utilization practices.

-- Description --
Traditional stone walls may become and EFA element. [Art. 45(3)(a) of (EU) R No 639/2014].

NOTE 1. Member States shall establish minimum criteria based on national or regional specificities, including limits to the dimensions of height and width.

NOTE 2. When this type of LF is protected under SMR 3, MS may specify other width based on  national requirements.

--Name--
Isolated tree

-- Definition --
Isolated tree in the agricultural area that is traditionally part of good agriculture cropping or utilization practices.

-- Description --
Such LF may become an EFA element when its crown diameter is of minimum 4 meters. [Art. 45(3)(b) of (EU) R No 639/2014].

NOTE 1: Member States may include trees designated by them as valuable landscape features with a crown diameter below 4 meters.

NOTE 2: When stable in time, this LF needs to be identified in the LPIS in view of checking their retention during OTSC. This identification of cross compliance Landscape Features can be done e.g. by alpha-numerical information (or by delineation) associated to the parcel

--Name--
Other LF protected by GAEC or SMR.

-- Definition --
Other LF protected by GAEC or SMR in the agricultural area that are part of good agriculture cropping or utilization practices.

-- Description --
Landscape feature, other features not listed in this code list but protected under GAEC7, SMR 2 or SMR 3 may become an EFA eleemnt. [Art. 45(3)(a) of (EU) R No  639/2014].

NOTE. When this type of LF is protected under GAEC 7 SMR 2 and SMR 3, MS shall provide semanic description and specification of properties (e.g. width).

labels.en: Landscape feature, other features not listed in this code list but protected under GAEC7, SMR 2 or SMR 3

definition.value:
--Name--
Ponds

-- Definition --
Ponds in the agricultural area that are traditionally part of good agriculture cropping or utilization practices.

-- Description --
Ponds may become an EFA element when their area is up to a maximum of 0.1 ha. Reservoirs made of concrete or plastic shall not be considered ecological focus area;   [Art. 45(3)(f) of (EU) R No 639/2014].

NOTE 1: MS may set a minimum size for ponds and they may decide that a strip with riparian vegetation along the water with a width of up to 10 meters is included in the size of the pond. They may establish criteria to ensure that ponds are of natural value, taking into account the role that natural ponds play for wildlife the conservation of habitats and species.

NOTE 2: When this type of LF is protected under GAEC 7 MS may specify other area  for ponds based on national requirements.

--Name--
Field margin

-- Definition --
Field margin in the agricultural area that is traditionally part of good agriculture cropping or utilization practices.

-- Description --
Field margin may become an EFA element when its width is between 1 and 20 meters. There shall be no agricultural production on it. [Art. 45(3)(e) of (EU) R No  639/2014].

NOTE 1. MS may establish a lower maximum width.

NOTE 2. When this type of LF is protected under SMR 3, MS may specify other width based on national requirements.

--Name--
Hedges and wooded strips

-- Definition --
Hedges and wooded strips in the agricultural area that are traditionally part of good agriculture cropping or utilization practices.

-- Description --
These LF may become EFA when their width does not exceed 10 meters. [Art. 45(3)(a) of (EU) R No 639/2014]

NOTE 1: When such LF are protected under GAEC 7, SMR 2 and SMR 3, MS may specify an other width based on national/regional requirements.

NOTE 2: This LF, when stable in time, need to be identified in the LPIS in view of checking their retention during OTSC. This identification of cross compliance Landscape Features can be done e.g. by alpha-numerical information (or by delineation) associated to the parcel.

--Name--
Reconverting obligation

--Definition--
Obligation to reconvert arable land into PG  according to the provisions of Art. 45(2) of R (EU) 1307/2014

--Description--
The reconversion obligation compensates the decrease of PG  by more than 5 % compared to a reference ratio to be established by Member States in 2015

NOTE
The land reconverted shall be considered as permanent grassland as of the first day of reconversion.

-- Definition --
Correspondents.
-- Description --
Notification senders and receivers.

--Name--
Cause of anomaly value

-- Definition --
Code list defining the values of the case of anomaly attribute.

-- Description --
List of possible anomaly causes used for documentation of an anomaly.

--Name--
Change in the perimeter due to addition of agricultural land

-- Description --
New agricultural area has been appended to an existing reference parcel.

NOTE. Previously known as Type III anomaly.

labels.en: Cause flaged as Type III. Change in the perimeter (addition of agricultural land)

definition.value:

definition.value:

-- Description --
The appearance of buildings, roads, and other sealed surfaces that are likely to stay in the place of former agricultural land more than three years.

labels.en: Cause flaged as Type II. The appearance of permanent construction

comment.en:
A GeometryCollection is a geometric object that is a collection of some number of geometric objects.
All the elements in a GeometryCollection shall be in the same Spatial Reference System. This is also the Spatial Reference System for the GeometryCollection.
GeometryCollection places no other constraints on its elements. Subclasses of GeometryCollection may restrict membership based on dimension and may also place other constraints on the degree of spatial overlap between elements.

A MultiSurface is a 2-dimensional GeometryCollection whose elements are Surfaces, all using coordinates from the same coordinate reference system. The geometric interiors of any two Surfaces in a MultiSurface may not intersect in the full coordinate system. The boundaries of any two coplanar elements in a MultiSurface may intersect, at most, at a finite number of Points. If they were to meet along a curve, they could be merged into a single surface.
A MultiSurface may be used to represent heterogeneous surfaces collections of polygons and polyhedral surfaces. It defines a set of methods for its subclasses. The subclass of MultiSurface is MultiPolygon corresponding to a collection of Polygons only. Other collections shall use MultiSurface.

--Name--
Pro-rata category value

-- Definition --
Pro rata categories represent groups of land cover classes that share an eligibility rate.

-- Description --
Categories are predefined by MS/Regions. The code list can be extended.

label.en: List of pro rata category values

definition.value:
--Name--
Grassland 90 percent 

-- Definition --
Grassland with 90 percent eligibility.

-- Description --
NOTE. If eligibility is above 90% then full eligibility applies (no pro rata).

--Name--
Grassland 50 percent

-- Definition --
Grassland  with 50 percent eligibility.

-- Description --
NOTE. If the rate of eligibility drops below 50%, a careful analysis of the standard deviation of the class RC assessment is due. Below 50% eligibility grasslands should only be in the eligibility profile when the class is very specific and if the scattering of its ineligible features produces a low standard deviation of the RC. Indeed, a 10% standard deviation on 45% eligibility indicates that nearly a quarter of the agricultural land is deemed uncertain.

Control Rate Group Rural Development Measure Value

List of control rate groups for rural development measures.

NOTE. Currently placeholder only.

label.en: List of control rate groups for rural development measures

definition.value:
-- Definition --
Notification pattern monthly.
-- Description --
Notification pattern with monthly notification properties.

--Name--
Status of anomaly value

-- Definition --
Code list of possible anomaly status values.

-- Description --
List of possible anomaly status values used for documentation of anomaly in the information system.

NOTE. Under information system IACS is understood. Most probably anomalies are registered in the Integrated control systems or in the quality assessment leaf of LPIS QA.

--Name--
Open

-- Definition --
Status of anomaly after recording it in the information system.

--Name--
In progress

-- Definition --
Status of the anomaly as soon as its processing has started or has been flagged for later resolution.

--Name--
Archived

-- Definition --
Status of anomaly as soon as it has been resolved.

--Description--
Anomalies are archived for historic reference.

--Name--
Homogeneity type value

-- Definition --
Code list of homogeneity types for single and homogenous geographical areas with similar agricultural and environmental conditions as referred to Art. 46(1) of (EU) R 639/2014.

-- Description --
It is a code list managed by the Commission Services, therefore is not extensible by the MS/regions.

--Name--
Natural area

-- Definition --
Natural area type according to objective criteria

-- Description --
Natural area types shall be defined based on objective criteria, for example:
-bio-geographical regions,
-habitats and biotopes,
-species distribution,
-climate zones,
-homogeneous geology,
-natural risk zones,
-protected sites (Natura 2000),
-river basin management, etc.

NOTE: the applicable values of natural area hall be documented in the eligibility profile of the MS/regions, and have to be described in a document dully cited or inserted in the information system.

EXAMPLE:  http://inspire.ec.europa.eu/applicationschema/ provides the list of INSPIRE  data themes (applications schemas) that may be used for selecting homogeneity criteria.

--Name--
Semi-natural area

-- Definition --
Semi natural area type according to objective criteria

-- Description --
Natural area types with human impact that further delimits homogeneity. 

NOTE: the applicable values of semi natural area hall be documented in the eligibility profile of the MS/regions, and have to be described in a document dully cited or inserted in the information system.

EXAMPLE:  http://inspire.ec.europa.eu/applicationschema/ provides the list of INSPIRE  data themes (applications schemas) that may be used for selecting homogeneity criteria.

--Name--
Elevation

-- Definition --
Homogeneity criteria established on elevation values.

-- Description --
Criteria that can be derived using digital elevation models for land surface.

NOTE: the criteria have to be documented in the eligibility profile of the MS/regions, or have to be described in a document dully cited or inserted in the information system.

--Name--
Soil type

-- Definition --
Soil type according to a well-established classification system.

-- Description --
The classification system shall be described or referred with a citation.

NOTE: the applicable values of soil type shall be documented in the eligibility profile of the MS/regions, or have to be described in a document dully cited or inserted in the information system.

EXAMPLE:  http://inspire.ec.europa.eu/codelist/ 
INSPIRE code list  registry comprising Soil data theme.

-- Definition --
Descriptions of cross-compliance rules.
-- Description --
Descriptions of cross-compliance rules. Usually defined by Member States responsible parties.
NOTE. https://marswiki.jrc.ec.europa.eu/gaec/index.php

--Name--
Conformance requirement statement value

--Definition--
List of conformance requirement statement values.

label.en: List of conformance requirement statement values

definition.value:
--Name--
Negative

--Definition--
Negative statement.

--Description--
Negative statement state what is required not to be observed.

--Name--
Positive

--Definition--
Affirmative statement.

--Description--
Positive statement state what is required to be done.

--Name--
ETS item under inspection

-- Definition--
Reference parcel or, where applicable, aggregation of reference parcels sampled for LPIS quality assessment process.

-- Description --
The attributes of the instances of this feature type (except the reference parcel ID and the declared area) are defined in course of direct observations and measurements carried out according to the specifications of the given LPIS. The procedures to be followed are described in the Perform ETS use case of the LPIS dynamic model. The inspection methodology is based on observing the land cover types present in the RP.

NOTE: Previously this  concept was called as land under inspection (LUI).  According to ISO 2859-2 "item" is the standard  term used for subjects of inspection. This approach also allows to extend the QA methodology for other objects (e.g. EFA elements).

comment.en:
A Curve is a 1-dimensional geometric object usually stored as a sequence of Points, with the subtype of Curve specifying the form of the interpolation between Points. This specification defines only one subclass of Curve, LineString, which uses linear interpolation between Points.
A Curve is a 1-dimensional geometric object that is the homeomorphic image of a real, closed, interval.
A Curve is simple if it does not pass through the same Point twice with the possible exception of the two end
points.
A Curve is closed if its start Point is equal to its end Point.
The boundary of a closed Curve is empty.
A Curve that is simple and closed is a Ring.
The boundary of a non-closed Curve consists of its two end Points.
A Curve is defined as topologically closed, that is, it contains its endpoints f(a) and f(b).

comment.en:
A MultiPoint is a 0-dimensional GeometryCollection. The elements of a MultiPoint are restricted to Points. ThePoints are not connected or ordered in any semantically important way.
A MultiPoint is simple if no two Points in the MultiPoint are equal (have identical coordinate values in X and Y).
Every MultiPoint is spatially equal to a simple Multipoint.
The boundary of a MultiPoint is the empty set.

-- Definition --
||Arable land.
-- Description --
Land use of Agriculture Area in Use -L
NOTE. Initial value:L0001

Sample Type value

The sample type property shall be attributed to each sampled item (application). One item can be sampled to one or more payment/support schemes. 

NOTE
The categories of sample type values have to support the traceability of the sampling cascade. This is the reason for distinguishing the initial and the top-up samples for BPS/SAPS.

Observing greening

Items selected for controlling beneficiaries observing greening. The composition of the population
	- 1,0-1,25% selected randomly 
	- 3,75-4,0% selected on risk base
The related sample includes items selected for the sensitive grassland sample.

Initial 1% and 1,25% for BPS/SAPS

It is the initial random sample drawn in sense of Art. 24(2)(a). This sample constitutes the basis of the following further samples:
	- Random part of the greening samples
	- Redistributive payment
	- Areas with natural constraints
	- Young farmers
	- Voluntary couples support
	- Hemp
	- Cotton

Hemp

Items selected for controlling beneficiaries growing hemp.

Small farmers

Item selected for controlling beneficiaries participating in the small farmers scheme.

Young farmers

Item selected for controlling beneficiaries applying for young farmer payment.

Regional implementation

Items selected for controlling beneficiaries participating in regional implementation of EFA. The composition of the population
	- 1,0-1,25% selected randomly 
	- 3,75-4,0% selected on risk base

Issue:
The purpose of collective implementation (See Art. 46(a) of 1307/2013) and regional implementation (see Art. 46(3) of R 639/2014) is to form contiguous areas of EFA. If so, what is the reason to have separate samples for collective implementation, regional implementation and contiguous EFA?

Regional/national certification scheme

Items selected for controlling greening according to Art.43 (3)(b) of R 1307/2013. The equivalent practices are listed in Annex IX of this regulation and the AgriculturalEquivalentPracticeTypeValue code list of the Aid applications and payment claims application schema.

Exempted from greening

Items selected to control beneficiaries exempted from greening obligations by not meeting the specified thresholds.  They include:
	- Beneficiaries exempted from crop diversification (Art. 44(3) of R 1307/2013)
	- Beneficiaries exempted from EFA (Art. 46 (1) of R 307/2013)

Areas with natural constraints

Item selected for controlling the correctness of payments for areas with natural constraints.

Collective implementation

Items selected for controlling beneficiaries participating in collective implementation of EFA. The composition of the population
	- 1,0-1,25% selected randomly 
	- 3,75-4,0% selected on risk base

Issue:
The purpose of collective implementation (See Art. 46(a) of 1307/2013) and regional implementation (see Art. 46(3) of R 639/2014) is to form contiguous areas of EFA. If so, what is the reason to have separate samples for collective implementation, regional implementation and contiguous EFA?

Contiguous EFA

Items selected for controlling contiguous EFA

Issue:
The purpose of collective implementation (See Art. 46(a) of 1307/2013) and regional implementation (see Art. 46(3) of R 639/2014) is to form contiguous areas of EFA. If so, what is the reason to have separate samples for collective implementation, regional implementation and contiguous EFA?

	- 3,75-4,0% selected on risk base

NOTE
This sample is included in the generic sample of beneficiaries that are mandated to observe greening.

Top-up for BPS/SAPS

Randomly selected items to complete the BPS/SAPS population after integrating the items out of the following samples:

comment.en:
A PolyhedralSurface is a contiguous collection of polygons, which share common boundary segments. For each pair of polygons that touch, the common boundary shall be expressible as a finite collection of LineStrings. Each such LineString shall be part of the boundary of at most 2 Polygon patches. 
For any two polygons that share a common boundary, the top of the polygon shall be consistent. This means that when two LinearRings from these two Polygons traverse the common boundary segment, they do so in opposite directions. Since the Polyhedral surface is contiguous, all polygons will be thus consistently oriented. This means that a non-oriented surface (such as Mbius band) shall not have single surface representations. They may be represented by a MultiSurface.
If each such LineString is the boundary of exactly 2 Polygon patches, then the PolyhedralSurface is a simple, closed polyhedron and is topologically isomorphic to the surface of a sphere. By the Jordan Surface Theorem (Jordans Theorem for 2-spheres), such polyhedrons enclose a solid topologically isomorphic to the interior of a sphere; the ball. In this case, the top of the surface will either point inward or outward of the enclosed finite solid. If outward, the surface is the exterior boundary of the enclosed surface. If inward, the surface is the interior of the infinite complement of the enclosed solid. A Ball with some number of voids (holes) inside can thus be presented as one exterior boundary shell, and some number in interior boundary shells.

definition.value:
--Name--
Contamination

-- Definition --
Unaccounted non-agricultural land cover features partly or totally located inside the item under inspection (Wikicap).

-- Description --
Instances of LC types that are not included in the eligibility profile. The contaminations shall be classified according to the ContaminationTypeValue code list. A contamination indicates that there is an issue with the parcel that should be further assesses (triggers an anomaly and a potential update of the parcel).

NOTE 1. Each contamination shall open an anomaly instance.

NOTE2. Each detected contamination is instantiated as a separate non-conformity from ETS v6.0.

NOTE 3. The concept of contamination is applicable only for those item under inspection that have "true" value of area conformity.

Application

Documentation of this feature type will be provided in frame of development of the Applications and payment claims application schema.

NOTE
This feature type is currently a draft.

--Name--
Classification Correctness DQM value

-- Definition --
Data quality measure describing the correctness of classification of the feature type.

-- Description --
The classification shall be performed according to the types defined in the eligibility profile. This DQM is applicable for evaluating the classification correctness of agricultural land(s) and the landscape feature(s) present in the item under inspection.  

NOTE: This is a new quality measure from ETS v 6.0 on.

label.en: IUI CC data quality measure type list

definition.value:
--Name--
Classification correctness

-- Definition --
Thematic classification correctness as defined in ISO 19157:2013.

-- Description --
Thematic classification correctness applied to the land cover class.

EXAMPLE:  A MS has defined Hedge landscape feature and Line of trees landscape feature. Attributing an instance of hedge to line of trees class is a classification error.

NOTE 1. The correct classification and quantification of the land cover types (arable/PC) is directly used for assessing the exemption for the green payments (EFA, crop diversification)

NOTE 2. The correct classification of the grassland is relevant because it acts as a threshold fors crop diversification. Certain types of grassland (pro-rata or not) are subject to specific requirements and therefore need to be distinguished (thus recorded).  In general, such detailed inspection triggers a better understanding of the pro-rata behaviour in the LPIS.
NOTE 3. Each pro-rata type shall be regarded as a separate land cover class For example permanent grassland of 50% is one class, and permanent grassland  90%  is another class. Therefore classifying an instance of permanent grassland of 50% to class permanent grassland  90%  a  is a classification error (like in the example above with the hedge and line of trees).

Agricultural area.

Agricultural Practice

Farmers entitled to a payment under BPS/ SAPS shall observe, on all their eligible hectares within the meaning of Article 32(2) to (5), the agricultural practices beneficial for the climate and the environment.

Sampling Strategy Type Value

List of sampling strategy types.

In accordance with Preamble (34) of R 809/2014 sampling should comprise a random part in order to obtain a representative error rate and a risk based part for the following Payment/support schemes:
	- greening payment
	- animal aid schemes
	- rural development measure

NOTE 1
To ensure a relevant and efficient risk analysis, the effectiveness of the risk analysis should be assessed and updated on an annual basis taking into account the relevance of each risk factor, comparing the results of randomly and risk-based selected samples and the specific situation [Preamble (68) and Art. 34(5) of R 809/2014].

NOTE 2
The sampling method should be selected and documented by the competent authority of the MS/Region. The values of the code list can be extended.

NOTE 3
The exemplary values of the code list in this application schema are taken from DSCG/2014/32 guideline and best statistical practices.

Systematic random selection

Random selection of the first initial item (i.e. application) and taking the rest based on the sequential number (e.g. every 100 application) [Section 1.3.2 of DSCG/2014/32].

NOTE 1
This method allows to start OTSC before the end of the application period.

NOTE 2
The sequential number has to be automatically assigned to the applications, or the key (i.e. property or properties) that serve for the basis of selection has to be specified and documented before starting the sampling process.

NOTE 3
The population has to be homogenous.

Risk based CART selection

A probability proportional risk based method for selecting and grouping items (applications) in risk groups based on a specific criterion (e.g. area not found) [DSCG/2014/32].

Stratified random selection

Method applicable when the population to be sampled is not homogenous. In order to achieve homogeneity, the population has to be sub-divided into strata based on objective criteria.

NOTE
The criteria for each stratum has to be registered.

Multistage sampling

Further, secondary sampling of clusters that have been  selected on geographic, or temporal criteria.

Simple random based selection

Selection from the full population of the dossiers through generation of a random key [Section 1.3.2 of DSCG/2014/32].

NOTE 1
The population has to be homogenous for this method.

NOTE 2
This method requires waiting until the full population is known.

Risk based multi-criteria selection

Risk based selection based on multi-criteria analysis.
Examples of aspects of analysis:
	- areas of recent land cover / land use change (from third party data)
	- Landscape
	- Agronomic conditions
	- Non-participation in FAS or certification schemes of farmers

NOTE 
The method is especially applicable for selecting risk based CwRS zones.

Simple risk based selection

Sampling process based on a single criterion retained to be effective in course of risk analysis. Input data for risk analysis can be taken from OTSC report of the previous year, other subsystems of IACS, third party data, etc.

NOTE 1
The effectiveness of the criterion has to be proved by comparing the performance results from a random sample and a sample based on the criterion. 

NOTE 2
The performance criterion has to be documented before  starting the sampling process.

Clustered random selection

Cluster sampling is a selection of items that are clustered (e.g. spatially or temporally) within the population.

EXAMPLE
Geographic cluster of a CwRS zone.

NOTE 1
The criteria for each cluster has to be registered.

NOTE 2
The clusters regarded as primary samples by geographic or temporal distribution can be further sampled by a second level of sampling. In that case the method is called multistage sampling.

comment.en:
Geometry is the root class of the hierarchy.
The instantiable subclasses of Geometry are restricted to 0, 1 and 2-dimensional geometric objects that exist in 2, 3 or 4-dimensional coordinate space (R2, R3 or R4). Geometry values in R2 have points with coordinate values for x and y. Geometry values in R3 have points with coordinate values for x, y and z or for x, y and m. Geometry values in R4 have points with coordinate values for x, y, z and m.
The interpretation of the coordinates is subject to the coordinate reference systems associated to the point. All coordinates within a geometry object should be in the same coordinate reference systems. Each coordinate shall be unambiguously associated to a coordinate reference system either directly or through its containing geometry. The z coordinate of a point is typically, but not necessarily, represents altitude or elevation. The m coordinate represents a measurement.
All Geometry classes described in this specification are defined so that instances of Geometry are topologically closed, i.e. all represented geometries include their boundary as point sets. This does not affect their representation, and open version of the same classes may be used in other circumstances, such as topological representations.

The regions to be defined shall consist of single and homogenous geographical areas with similar agricultural and environmental conditions. Ecological focus areas must be contiguous for regional implementation (and must be subject to collective implementation).

NOTE.

Rapid field visit

Combined measurement using field (e.g. GNSS)and  Remote Sensing methods.

NOTE 1
In the event that photo-interpretation of orthoimages (satellite or aerial) do not provide results that would permit definitive conclusions to be drawn to the satisfaction of the competent authority concerning the eligibility or the correct size of the area that is the subject of administrative or on-the-spot checks [Art. 24(4) of R 809/2014].

NOTE 2

Field measurement

--Name--
Abstract test case

--Definition--
Generalized test for a particular requirement [ISO19105:2000].

--Description--
An abstract test case is a formal basis for deriving executable test cases. One or more test purposes are encapsulated in an abstract test case. An abstract test case is independent of both the implementation and the values. It should be complete in the sense that it is sufficient to assign a test verdict unambiguously to each potentially observable test outcome (i.e. sequence of test events).

--Name--
Ecological focus area type value

-- Definition --
Types of EFA as listed in Art. 46(2) of (EU) R 1307/2013.

-- Description --
MS shall decide that one or more values of this code list  are considered to be ecological focus area.

NOTE 1: Member States may decide to limit the selection of landscape features to those under GAEC 7, SMR 2 or SMR 3  as referred to in Annex II to Regulation (EU) No 640/2013 and/or to one or more of those listed in point (a) to (h) of the first subparagraph, where duly justified. Should it be the case, the code list of EFA types have to be modifie accordingly.

NOTE 2: The extension of this code list shall be documented in the eligibility profile of the MS/region. It is recommended to use  a register / registry service to publish the extended values and their definitions.

NOTE 3: Landscape features shall be:
-at the disposal of the farmer;
-shall be those that are protected under GAEC 7, SMR 2 or SMR 3 as referred to in Annex II to Regulation (EU) No 640/2014.

--Name--
Areas with short rotation coppice

-- Definition --
Ecological focus area type as defined by Art. 46(2) of (EU) R 1307/2013.

-- Description --
Areas with short rotation coppice  with no use of mineral fertiliser and/or plant protection products.

NOTE:  MS shall establish:
- a list of species that can be used for this purpose, by selecting from the list established pursuant to Article 4(2)(c) of R (EU) No 1307/2013;
- the requirements as regards the use of mineral fertilisers and plant protection products, keeping in mind the objective of this particular form of ecological focus areas in particular to safeguard and improve biodiversity.

--Name--
Land laying fallow

-- Definition --
Land laying fallow for application of ecological focus area type selected under Art. 46(2) of (EU) R 1307/2013.

-- Description --
On land lying fallow there shall be no agricultural production. By way of derogation from Article 4(1)(h) of ( EU) R No 639/2014, land lying fallow for the purpose of fulfilling the ecological focus area  for more than five years shall remain arable land.

--Name--

-- Description --
Landscape features: Hedges/wooded strips with a width of up to 10 meters [Art. 45(3)(a) of (EU) R No 639/2014]

NOTE 1: When  such LF are protected under GAEC 7, SMR 2 and SMR 3, MS may specify other width based on national requirements.

NOTE 2: This LF, when stable in time, need to be identified in the LPIS in view of checking their retention during OTSC. This identification of cross compliance Landscape Features can be done e.g. by alpha-numerical information (or by delineation) associated to the parcel.

NOTE: Member States shall establish minimum criteria based on national or regional specificities, including limits to the dimensions of height and width.

NOTE 2: When this type of LF is protected under SMR 3, MS may specify other width based on  national requirements.

--Name--

-- Definition --
Ecological focus area type as defined by Art. 46(2) of (EU) R 1307/2013

-- Description --
Strips of eligible hectares along forest edges with production.

NOTE: width shall be defined by the MS within the limits
- minimum shall not be below 1 meter
- maximum width shall be 10 meters.

labels.en: Strips of eligible hectares along forest edges with production

definition.value:
--Name--
LF ponds

-- Definition --
Ecological focus area type as defined by Art. 46(2) of (EU) R 1307/2013.

-- Description --
Landscape feature, ponds of up to a maximum of 0.1 ha. Reservoirs made of concrete or plastic shall not be considered ecological focus area;   [Art. 45(3)(f) of (EU) R No 639/2014].

NOTE 1: MS may set a minimum size for ponds and they may decide that a strip with riparian vegetation along the water with a width of up to 10 meters is included in the size of the pond. They may establish criteria to ensure that ponds are of natural value, taking into account the role that natural ponds play for wildlife the conservation of habitats and species.

NOTE 2: When this type of LF is protected under GAEC 7 MS may specify other area  for ponds based on national requirements.

--Name--
Areas with Catch crops or green cover

-- Definition --
Ecological focus area type as defined by Art. 46(2) of (EU) R 1307/2013.

-- Description --
Areas with catch crops or green cover established by the planting and germination of seeds, subject to the application of weighting factors referred to in paragraph 3 of this Article.

Areas under catch crops or green cover shall include:
- areas established pursuant to the requirements under SMR 1;
- other areas  on the condition that they were established by sowing a mixture of crop species or by under-sowing grass in the main crop. 

NOTE: MS shall establish set up specific rules, including the list of mixtures of crop species to be used and the period for the sowing  and may establish additional conditions notably with regard to production methods. The period to be set by Member States shall not extend after 1 October.

labels.en: Areas with catch crops or green cover

definition.value:
--Name--
LF isolated tree

-- Definition --
Ecological focus area type as defined by Art. 46(2) of (EU) R 1307/2013.

-- Description --
Landscape feature, isolated tree with a crown diameter of minimum 4 meters.  [Art. 45(3)(b) of (EU) R No 639/2014].

NOTE 1: Member States may include trees recognised by them as valuable landscape features with a crown diameter below 4 meters.

NOTE 2: When stable in time, this LF needs to be identified in the LPIS in view of checking their retention during OTSC. This identification of cross compliance Landscape Features can be done e.g. by alpha-numerical information (or by delineation) associated to the parcel.

--Name--
Areas with nitrogen fixing crop

-- Definition --
Ecological focus area type as defined by Art. 46(2) of (EU) R 1307/2013.

-- Description --
Areas with nitrogen fixing crops.

NOTE: A list of nitrogen-fixing crops shall be established by the MS [Art. 45(10) (EU) R No 637/2014].

--Name--
LF ditches

-- Definition --
Ecological focus area type as defined by Art. 46(2) of (EU) R 1307/2013.

-- Description --
Landscape feature, ditches with a maximum width of 6 meters, including open watercourses for the purpose of irrigation or drainage. Channels with walls of concrete shall not be considered ecological focus area.   [Art. 45(3)(g) of (EU) R No  639/2014].

NOTE : When this type of LF is protected under SMR 3, MS may specify other width based on  national requirements.

--Name--
LF trees in line

-- Definition --
Ecological focus area type as defined by Art. 46(2) of (EU) R 1307/2013.

-- Description --
Landscape feature, trees in line  trees in line with a crown diameter of minimum 4 meters. The space between the crowns shall not exceed 5 meters. [Art. 45(3)(c) of (EU) R No  639/2014].

NOTE 1: Member States may include trees recognised by them as valuable landscape features with a crown diameter below 4 meters.

NOTE 2: When this type of LF is protected under GAEC 7, SMR 3, MS may specify other width based on national requirements.

--Name--
Hectares of agro-forestry

-- Definition --
Ecological focus area type as defined by Art. 46(2) of (EU) R 1307/2013

-- Description --
Hectares of agro-forestry
- are those that receive, or have received, support under Article 44 of Regulation (EC) No 1698/2005 and/or Article 23 of Regulation (EU) No 1305/2013
- shall be arable land eligible for the basic payment scheme or the single area payment scheme  for which support under Article 44 of Regulation (EC) No 1698/2005 or Article 23 of Regulation (EU) No 1305/2013 was or is granted.

--Name--
Buffer strips

-- Definition --
Ecological focus area type as defined by Art. 46(2) of (EU) R 1307/2013.

-- Description --
Buffer strips, including buffer strips covered by permanent grassland, provided that these are distinct from adjacent eligible agricultural area [Art. 46(2) (d) of (EU) R 1307/2013].

NOTE 1: Buffer strips shall include the buffer strips:
- along water courses required under GAEC 1, SMR 1 or SMR 10 as referred to in Annex II to Regulation (EU) No 640/2014;
- other buffer strips defined by MS. minimum width that shall not be below 1 meter.

NOTE 2: Buffer strips shall be located on or adjacent to an arable field with their long edges parallel to the edge of a water course or water body.

NOTE 3:  Along water courses, buffer strips may include strips with riparian vegetation with a width of up to 10 meters with no agricultural production. (By way of derogation MS may allow grazing or cutting, provided that the buffer strip remains distinguishable from adjacent agricultural land).

--Name--
LF Group of trees

-- Definition --
Ecological focus area type as defined by Art. 46(2) of (EU) R 1307/2013.

-- Description --
Landscape feature, group of trees, where trees are connected by overlapping crown cover, and field copses of maximum 0.3 ha in both cases.   [Art. 45(3)(d) of (EU) R No 639/2014].

labels.en: Landscape feature, group of trees/Field copses

definition.value:
--Name--
LF field margine

-- Definition --
Ecological focus area type as defined by Art. 46(2) of (EU) R 1307/2013.

-- Description --
Landscape feature, field margin with a width between 1 and 20 meters, on which there shall be no agricultural production.   [Art. 45(3)(e) of (EU) R No  639/2014].

NOTE1:  MS may establish a lower maximum width.

NOTE 2: When this type of LF is protected under SMR 3, MS may specify other width based on  national requirements.

--Name--
Strips of eligible hectares without production

-- Definition --
Ecological focus area type as defined by Art. 46(2) of (EU) R 1307/2013

-- Description --
Strips of eligible hectares along forest edges without production. 

NOTE 1: by way of derogation from the no production requirement, grazing or cutting may be allowed, provided the strip remains distinguishable from adjacent agricultural land. 

NOTE 2: width shall be defined by the MS within the limits
- minimum shall not be below 1 meter
- maximum width shall be 10 meters.

labels.en: Strips of eligible hectares along forest edges without production

Agricultural practice requirement value

List of agricultural practice requirement values as defined in Art. (44) (1), (2),(3) and Art. 46 (4) of R (EU) 1307/2013.

At 75 % of arable covered by grasses or land lying fallow 

When grasses or other herbaceous forage or land lying fallow cover more than 75 % of the arable land and the remaining area of other uses does not exceed 30 ha, R (EU) 1307/2013 allows the following exemptions:
	- According to Art. 41(3)(a) crop diversification
	- According to  Art. 46(4)(a) EFA


NOTE 
For EFA exemption, also cultivation of leguminous crops on more than 75% of the arable land qualifies for the exemption.

At least 5% EFA

According to Art.(46)(1) when arable land of a holding covers more than 15 hectares at least 5% of EFA shall be implemented.

At least 7% EFA

Increased 7 % of EFA mandatory for holdings with area more than 15 ha.

NOTE
As this provision is subject to a legislative act of the European Parliament and of the Council this value currently is a placeholder.

Minimum Activity

Minimum activity, defined by Member States, on agricultural areas naturally kept in a state suitable for grazing or cultivation [Art.(4)(1)(iii) of R (EU) 1307/2013].

At least three crops

According to Art. 46(1) second paragraph the value can be assigned when
	- arable land more than 30 ha
	- not entirely cultivated with crops under water
	- main crop shall not cover more than 75 % of arable land
	- two main crops together shall not cover more than 95 % of arable land.

At least 75% permanent grassland

When permanent grassland, other herbaceous forage or crops under water cover more than 75 % of the land and the remaining area of other uses does not exceed 30 ha, R (EU) 1307/2013 allows the following exemptions:
	- According to Art. 41(3)(b) crop diversification
	- According to  Art. 46(4)(b) EFA

NOTE 1
Combination of the above uses is allowed

NOTE 2
Under water cultivation applies for the significant part of the year or the vegetative cycle.

At least two crops

According to Art. 46(1) first paragraph the value can be assigned when
	- arable land  is between 10 and 30 ha
	- not entirely cultivated with crops under water
	- main crop shall not cover more than 75 % of arable land.

50% of arable not declared in previous year

According to Art.(3)(c) of R (EU) 1307/2013 beneficiaries do not need to follow crop diversification when

	- more than 50 % of the areas of arable land declared were not declared by the farmer in his aid application of the previous year
AND
	- all arable land is being cultivated with a different crop compared to that of the previous calendar year

NOTE
The second condition shall be verified on the basis of comparison of the geo- spatial aid applications

North of 62nd parallel

According to Art.(3)(d) of R (EU) 1307/2013 beneficiaries have special crop diversification rules for holdings that are
	- situated in areas north of 62nd parallel or certain adjacent areas
AND
	- arable land of such holdings covers more than 10 hectares, there shall be at least two crops on the arable land
	-  none of these crops shall cover more than 75 % of the arable land, unless the main crop is grasses or other herbaceous forage, or land lying fallow.

comment.en:
A Point is a 0-dimensional geometric object and represents a single location in coordinate space. 
A Point has an x-coordinate value, a y-coordinate value. If called for by the associated Spatial Reference System, it may also have coordinate values for z and m.
The boundary of a Point is the empty set.

Agricultural equivalent practice subtype value

Broad categories of agricultural equivalent practices beneficial for the climate and the environment as listed in Annex IX of R 1307/2013.

Equivalent to Ecological Focus Area

Practices equivalent to ecological focus area as listed in  III) of Annex IX of R 1307/2013:
	- Ecological set aside
	- Creation of "buffer zones" for high nature value areas
	-  Management of uncultivated buffer strips, patches and field margins 
	- Borders, in-field strips and patches managed for wildlife or specific fauna
	- Management (pruning, trimming, dates, methods, restoration) of landscape features
	- Keeping arable peaty or wet soils under grass (with no use of fertilisers and no use of plant protection products)
	- Production on arable land with no use of fertiliser (mineral fertiliser and manure) and/or plant protection products, and not irrigated, not sown with the same crop two years in a row and on a fixed place
	- Conversion of arable land into permanent grassland extensively used

labels.en: Practices equivalent with ecological focus area

definition.value:
Equivalent to maintenance of permanent grassland

Practices equivalent to the maintenance of permanent grassland as listed in II) of Annex IX of R 1307/2013:
	- Management of meadows or pastures
	- Extensive grazing systems

labels.en: Practices equivalent to maintenance of permanent grassland: Management of meadows or pastures

definition.value:
Equivalent to crop diversification

Practices equivalent to crop diversification as listed in I) of Annex IX of R 1307/2013:
	- crop diversification(with different requirements)
	- crop rotation
	- winter soil cover
	- catch crop

labels.en: Practices equivalent to crop diversification: Crop diversification

--Name--

--Definition--
