--Description--
This will allow the implementation to be tested for conformance against the relevant requirements - and against those requirements only.

NOTE. ICS gives information to the testing laboratory for the definition of the domain of testing.

--Name--
Agricultural area

-- Definition --
"Agricultural area" means any area taken up by arable land, permanent grassland and permanent pasture, or permanent crops. Art. 4(1)(e) of R 1307/2013.

-- Description --
Areas taken by these land cover types, or their subtypes (narrower categories) comprising designated landscape features and/or trees included in these areas [DSCG/2014/33].

NOTE 1: The distinction between the different types of agricultural area should be done in two ways depending on the situation:
- By alphanumerical recording of the types and the corresponding area values as attributes of the reference parcel (RP),
- By delineation (assigning geometries to each type within the RP).

NOTE 2: For calculating greening obligations the area of LF shall be accounted as part of the "parent"  land cover type (i.e. LC type where they are embedded in or are adjacent to). In case a designated landscape feature lays at the boundary of two LC types its area shall be subdivided.

NOTE 3: The maximum width of eligible LF  is 2 m, unless the LF has been designated under Art. 9(2) of R (EU) No 640/2014 as subject of cross compliance, or unless the MS notified about eligibility to the Commission before 09/12/2009.  

NOTE 4:  The provisions of Art. 9(1) of Regulation (EU) No 640/2014 cannot apply to permanent grassland with landscape features and trees where the MS has decided to apply Art. 10 of the same Regulation (pro-rata system). 

NOTE 5:  Non agricultural areas (not taken up with the allowed LC types) above 100 sq.m. shall be excluded by delineation.

NOTE 6: It is not necessary to deduct the area of a non agricultural area LC type when it is smaller than 100 sq.m. However, in course of OTSC and LPIS QA,  when the cumulative area (per type) of such smaller features is more than 100 sq.m., the deduction shall be applied.

NOTE 7: Woods (in parcels not declared as short rotation coppice) should be interpreted as areas within an agricultural parcel with tree-cover (including bushes, etc.) preventing growth of vegetative under-storey suitable for grazing and should thus be excluded from the eligible area of the RP [DSCG/2014/33]. 

NOTE 8: MS shall define the maximum tree density to be applied when assessing eligibility together with the characteristics of the trees. Grazable trees on permanent grasslands should not be counted. Groups of threes shall not be spread over the whole area, but shall be excluded if bigger than 100 sq.m..

NOTE 9: Each pro-rata category shall correspond to separate LC type.

definition.value:
-- Definition --
Arable land.
-- Description --
Land worked (ploughed or tilled) regularly, generally under a system of crop rotation.
Crop rotation is the practice of alternating annual crops grown on a specific field in a planned pattern or sequence in successive crop years so that crops of the same species are not grown without interruption on the same field. Normally the crops are changed annually, but they can also be multiannual. To distinguish arable land from permanent crops or permanent grassland, a threshold of five years is used. This means that if a plot is used for the same crop for five years or more, without in the meantime removing the preceding crop and establishing a new one, it is not considered arable land.
NOTE. Initial value:2.01

-- Description --
Area previously used as an agricultural area and, during the reference year of the survey, no longer worked for economic, social or other reasons and which is not used in the crop rotation system, i.e. land where no agricultural use is intended.
This land could be brought back into cultivation using the resources normally available on an agricultural holding.

Mixtures of predominantly leguminous (normally > 80 %) forage crops and grass plants, harvested green or as dried hay are included here.

-- Definition --
Fallow land.
-- Description --
All arable land included in the crop rotation system, whether worked or not, but with no intention to produce a harvest for the duration of a crop year.
The essential characteristic of fallow land is that it is left to recover, normally for the whole of a crop year.
Fallow land may be:
1. bare land bearing no crops at all;
2. land with spontaneous natural growth, which may be used as feed or ploughed in;
3. land sown exclusively for the production of green manure (green fallow).
All areas of arable land maintained in good agricultural and environmental conditions as set out in Article 5 of the Council Regulation (EC) No 1782/2003(1)
OJ L 270, 21.10.2003, p. 1. (1) or, where applicable, in the most recent legislation, regardless of whether they are part of the crop rotation or not, are included.
NOTE. Initial value:2.01.12

-- Definition --
Temporary grass.
-- Description --
Grass plants for grazing, hay or silage included as a part of a normal crop rotation, lasting at least one crop year and less than five years, sown with grass or grass mixtures. The areas are broken up by ploughing or other tilling or the plants are destroyed by other means such as by herbicides before they are sown again.
Mixtures of predominantly grass plants and other forage crops (usually leguminous), grazed, harvested green or as dried hay are included here.

definition.value:
--Name--
EFA classification correctness

- Definition --
This is a placeholder only; currently not to be implemented.

Thematic classification correctness. The assignment of an item to a certain class can either be correct or incorrect. [ISO 19157].

-- Description --
Thematic classification correctness applied to the EFA.
NOTE. Must have separate DQM_Measure description.

--Name--
EFA relative area correctness

-- Definition --
This is a placeholder only; currently not to be implemented.

Conformance statement applicable on the value of relative area correctness.

-- Description --
The conformance thresholds are area dependent.
NOTE. Must have separate DQM_Measure description.

--Name--
Test type value

-- Definition --
Indication whether a test belong to the basic or the capability test type.

-- Description --
A basic test is an initial test intended to identify clear cases of non-conformance. If the ATS identifies tests to be used as basic tests, they shall be used at the start of the conformance assessment process.

Capability test is designed to determine whether an IUT conforms to a particular characteristic specified as requirements.

--Name--
Basic

-- Definition --
Basic test .

-- Description --
Basic tests (BT) provide limited testing of IUT in order to establish whether or not it is appropriate to perform more thorough testing. They may be used to determine the degree of conformance prior to deciding whether or not to proceed with thorough capability testing. Basic tests are simple capability tests. Conformance clauses should identify those test cases that may be used as a basic test.

NOTE1. BT shall be used to for detecting obvious cases of non-conformity.

NOTE2. BT shall be used as a preliminary step in order to decide whether or not to run capability tests.

--Name--
Capability

-- Definition --
Capability test.

-- Description --
Capability tests (CT), should investigate an implementation as thoroughly as it is practical over the full range of conformance requirements specified in a standard/legal act. Capability tests should be provided to check the mandatory capabilities and those optional capabilities that are identified in the ICS as being supported by the IUT.

NOTE 1. CT shall be used to check that the capabilities of the IUT are consistent with the conformance requirements, that is, to determine whether or not an implementation conforms.

NOTE 2. CT shall be used to investigate causes of failure.

-- Definition --
Implementation eXtra Information for testing.

-- Description --
Statement containing all of the information related to the IUT and its corresponding SUT which will enable the testing laboratory to run an appropriate test suite against that IUT (ISO19105). IXIT typically provides the details on the organization and storage of concepts in the SUT as well as on the means of access to and modification of the SUT.
NOTE. IXIT gives information to testing laboratory on how to perform the testing.

definition.value:
--Name--
Inspection method  value

-- Definition --
Data collection methods applicable for LPISQA.

-- Description --
MS/Regions shall chose on of the following methods:
- field survey,
- computer assisted photo interpretation (CAPI)
- combined CAPI and field measurements.

--Name--
Combined CAPI and filed survey

-- Definition --
Combined method of inspection using CAPI and field survey.

-- Description --
The default inspection method is CAPI. In case when the measurement of the item is not feasible, or unambiguous classification of land cover is not possible, field visit shall be performed. Therefore there are three options: 
1. Combined CAPI supported by land cover detection and area measurement in the field,
2. Combined CAPI supported by land cover detection only in the field,
3. Combined CAPI supported by area measurement only in the field.

NOTE: At this method the "False" value of the feasibilityForMeasurement attribute of ETSItemUnderInspection feature type can be very rarely assigned, only if the measurement is not feasible in the field (force major).

--Name--
Field survey

-- Definition --
Observations and measurements necessary for inspection are performed exclusively in the field.

-- Description --
Measurements can be performed by any means listed in the common technical specifications (e.g. GNSS, total station, etc.)

NOTE: In ETS 5.3 the value used to be field inspection.

--Name--
Computer assisted photo interpretation (CAPI)

-- Definition --
Computer assisted photo interpretation method of inspection.

-- Description --
All observations and measurements are performed on the basis of orthtoimagery using suitable GIS software.

comment.en: A LinearRing is a LineString that is both closed and simple.

A MultiCurve is a 1-dimensional GeometryCollection whose elements are Curves.
A MultiCurve defines a set of methods for its subclasses and is included for reasons of extensibility.
A MultiCurve is simple if and only if all of its elements are simple and the only intersections between any two elements occur at Points that are on the boundaries of both elements.
The boundary of a MultiCurve is obtained by applying the mod 2 union rule: A Point is in the boundary of a MultiCurve if it is in the boundaries of an odd number of elements of the MultiCurve.
A MultiCurve is closed if all of its elements are closed. The boundary of a closed MultiCurve is always empty.
A MultiCurve is defined as topologically closed.

--Name--
Area conformance

--Definition --
Conformance statement based on the value of relative area correctness. 

-- Description --
The conformance thresholds are area dependent:
- area >5000 sq.m. : 97,00% - 103,00% conforming;
- 2000 sq.m.<area<5000 sq.m.: 95% - 105% conforming;
- area<2000 sq.m.: 93%-107% conforming.

Measure identifier: I_ACON
Name: Item area conformance
Alias: Parcel area conformance
Element name: Domain consistency
Basic measure: Error indicator
Value type: Boolean
Value Structure: n.a.

NOTE. Previously  it was part of RP conformance - code list for conformance level.

Item contamination conformance

-- Definition --
Conformance statement on the value of contaminations.

-- Description --
The item is conforming when t is contamination free, or the contaminations found are waivered. 

Measure identifier: I_CCON
Name: Item contamination conformance
Alias: Parcel contamination conformance
Element name: Domain consistency
Basic measure: Error indicator
Value type: Boolean
Value Structure: n.a.

Relative area correctness

-- Definition --
Ability of the reference area to quantify the area of all eligible land cover types present in the inspected item. 

-- Description --
Measure identifier: I_RAC
Name: Relative area correctness
Alias: Relative area accuracy
Element name: Relative or internal accuracy
Basic measure: Error rate
Value type: Measure. Result output shall be provided in %.
Value Structure: n.a.

NOTE. Previously named: 10101 RP_MEA.

--Name--
Area difference correctness

-- Definition --
Difference between eligible recorded area and observed area.

-- Description --
Measure identifier: I_ADC
Name: Area difference correctness
Alias: Area difference accuracy
Element name: Relative  or internal accuracy
Value type: Measure
Value Structure: n.a.

NOTE 1: This measure is applicable for parcels >10000 sq.m.

NOTE 2: Previously named: RP conformance (area purity) v2, 10102 RP_CNF.

--Name--
Critical defect conformance

--Definition --
Conformance statement based on the detection of critical defect conditions.

-- Description --
The item under inspection is conforming when no critical defect occurs (i.e. the multiplicity of the association role from ItemUnderInspection to CriticalDefect is zero).

Measure identifier: I_CDCON
Name: Item critical defect conformance
Alias: Critical defect conformance
Element name: Domain consistency
Value type: Boolean
Value Structure: n.a.

--Name--
Item conformance

-- Definition --
Conformance statement on the item under inspection.

-- Description --
The item under inspection is conforming when no associated feature type is misclassified, it is contamination free or the contaminations found are waivered, and it is conforming in terms of area. The values of classificationCorrectness, waivered and areaConformance shall be true.
NOTE: since the conformance in term of critical defect is evaluated separately, the scope of this measure does not contain critical defects. 

Measure identifier: I_CON
Name: Item conformance
Alias: Parcel conformance
Element name: Domain consistency
Basic measure: Error indicator
Value type: Boolean
Value Structure: n.a.

On-the-spot check

Checks organised by a MS/Region supplementing the systematic administrative checks [Art. 59(1) of R 1306/2013].

NOTE 1
Member States shall organise on-the-spot checks on approved operations using an appropriate sampling basis. Those checks shall, to the extent possible, be carried out before the final payment is made for an operation. 

NOTE 2
The inspectors undertaking the on-the-spot check shall not have been involved in administrative checks of the same operation.

NOTE 3
This feature type does not describe the on-the-spot check carried out by the Commission

Type

Types include data types, enumerated types, code list values, etc.

EXAMPLE 1. Primitive types defined in international standards: integer, boolean, GM_Object, etc.

EXAMPLE 2. Own types defined in the model and re-used for different purposes. LPIS QA uses the TechnicalReasonValue type to describe critical defects and contaminations with the same technical terms.

EXAMPLE 3. Types defined in other model and imported for re-use. LCM uses  DocumentCitation type defined in INSPIRE.

The Object Constraint Language (OCL) is a declarative language for describing rules that apply to Unified Modelling Language (UML) models.

A class that specifies set of spatial objects sharing common properties and operations applicable to the objects.

--Name--
Attribute

UML feature  within a classifier that describes a range of values (B.515) that instances of the classifier may hold. [ISO/TS 19103:2005 – adapted from ISO/IEC 19501]

For purposes of LCM, this term is used for proprietary (user-defined) and imported (from third parties) data types.

Application schema

-- Definition --
Conceptual schema for data required for one or more applications [ISO 19101:2002].

--Name-- 
Feature level metadata

-- Definition --
Information describing spatial resources, making it possible to discover, inventory and use them.

-- Description --
Feature-level metadata are attributes of a feature type that is used to store auxiliary information about the data record belonging to that type. Feature level metadata can include information about the life-cycle, status, data quality, usability, responsible entity, etc.

NOTE 1. The date of the beginLifespanVersion shall be earlier than the date of endLifespanVersion.
/* If set, the date endLifespanVersion shall be later than beginLifespanVersion. */
inv: self.endLifespanVersion .isAfter(self.beginLifespanVersion)

NOTE 2. The value (date) of the validFrom attribute shall be earlier than the date of validTo attribute.

/* If set, the date validTo shall be equal or later than validFrom. */
inv: self.validTo .isEqual(self.validFrom) or self.validTo .isAfter(self.validFrom)

NOTE 3. The new CAP legislation is applicable from 2015 onward.
inv: campaignYear >= 2015

comment.en:
A Surface is a 2-dimensional geometric object.
A simple Surface may consists of a single patch that is associated with one exterior boundary and 0 or more interior boundaries. A single such Surface patch in 3-dimensional space is isometric to planar Surfaces, by a simple affine rotation matrix that rotates the patch onto the plane z = 0. If the patch is not vertical, the projection onto the same plane is an isomorphism, and can be represented as a linear transformation, i.e. an affine.
Polyhedral Surfaces are formed by stitching together such simple Surfaces patches along their common boundaries. Such polyhedral Surfaces in a 3-dimensional space may not be planar as a whole, depending on the orientation of their planar normals. If all the patches are in alignment (their normals are parallel), then the whole stitched polyhedral surface is co-planar and can be represented as a single patch if it is connected.
The boundary of a simple Surface is the set of closed Curves corresponding to its exterior and interior boundaries.
A Polygon is a simple Surface that is planar. A PolyhedralSurface is a simple surface, consisting of some number of Polygon patches or facets. If a PolyhedralSurface is closed, then it bounds a solid. A MultiSurface containing a set of closed PolyhedralSurfaces can be used to represent a Solid object with holes.

definition.value:
--Name--
ETS sample

-- Definition --
Set of randomly selected parcel with ordered sequence.

-- Description --
The inspection process follows the sequential order prescribed by DG JRC.

--Name--
MTS  test type values

--Definition--
Abstract test cases applicable in model based testing for LPISQA.

--Description--
These abstract test cases are applicable for conformance testing of the eligibility profile in general. They should  be further specified  in the executable test cases according to the implementation choices of the MS/Regions.

--Name--
Attribute and association completeness

--Definition --
Completeness of the eligibility profile  in terms of attributes and associations  as compared to the LCM. Eventual omissions trigger fail verdict in the corresponding tests.

-- Description --
All attributes and association roles defined in the LCM are mandatory.  When feature types of the eligibility profile include more attributes than defined in the LCM, this does not influence conformity. However, the definition of these attributes should not semantically clash with the definitions of those, already defined in the LCM. Omitted attributes/association rules found in course of testing triggers fail verdict in this test.

NOTE 1. From semantic and UML points of view attributes and associations are equivalent. Both describe the properties of the related class (feature type, or data type).

NOTE 2. Zero (0) multiplicity describes a natural state (semantic property) of the attribute/association. Therefore it should not be interpreted as indicator of optional implementation.

NOTE 3. Zero (0) multiplicity of abstract only concepts (no corresponding tangible entities in the real world) means that within a smaller their use is not required. EXAMPLE: identifiers  may not be required for specific uses.

NOTE 4. This is a capability test case.

--Name--
Schema mapping

-- Definition --
Definition of mapping rules  from the national / regional eligibility profile to the LCM.

-- Description-- 
The mapping rules shall be defined for all elements (feature types, code lists, enumerations)  rendering the elements of the source schema (eligibility profile) with the corresponding elements of the LCM. 

Each feature type of the national / regional eligibility profile can be mapped to one or more feature types of the LCM. This mapping rule has to be unambiguous.

NOTE . This is a basic test case.

--Name--
Feature type completeness

--Definition --
Completeness of the eligibility profile  in terms of feature types as compared to the LCM.

-- Description --
All feature type included in the LCM shall be present in the eligibility profile. No one to one relationship  between the corresponding feature types is required. However, rules for schema mapping shall be unambiguous. 

NOTE 1. As best practice, EC services recommend the following solutions:
- one to one mapping between the feature types of the eligibility profile and the LCM
- A feature type in the eligibility profile is a specialisation of a feature type in the LCM.

NOTE 2. This is a capability test case.

--Name--
Value type

--Definition --
Type of the value that a specific attribute can take.

-- Description --
Value types can be specified using one of the following methods:
- selecting types of from the conceptual schema language and reference schemas (standards, INSPIRE)
- Data type specified in reference schemas or in the LCM
- Enumeration
- Code list

NOTE 1. for extensible code lists other values than specified in it can be introduced in the eligibility profile. The extended values shall not have semantic clashes with those values, specified in the LCM. When extension with "narrower" values is allowed, the an new value should be a semantic restriction of the parent value. For example "permanent crop" can be extended with "citrus tree".

NOTE 2. This is a capability test case.

--Name--
Value and constraint

--Definition --
Range or restricted range of values that a property can take.

-- Description --
Constraints are set on value type, values, and association rules in the LCM. Some of them are conditional.

NOTE 1. Unit of measure test is a specific constraint set in order to verify whether area values are expressed in the units specified in the LCM.

NOTE 2. This is a capability test case.

--Name--
Multiplicity

--Definition --
Number of currencies of a property (attribute or association).

-- Description --
Number of occurrences shall be exactly those that is specified in the LCM;
- 0: no value appears for the property 
- 1: only one value can be provided
-1..*: one or more value may be provided

NOTE 1. Multiplicities for attributes are indicated after the value type in [brackets]. If No brackets appear the specified multiplicity is 1.

NOTE 2. Multiplicity for association appears at the ends of the connectors representing the association role. Multiplicity rules shall be read in the direction of navigability (direction of "arrows").

NOTE 3. This is a capability test case.

--Name--
Schema definition test

--Definition--
Completeness of the documentation of the eligibility profile.

--Description--
All implementation choices (differences of the eligibility profile as compared to the LCM) shall be thoroughly  documented. In particular, extended code lists, and constraints  shall be clearly documented and communicated to various actors (OTSC inspectors, auditors, EC services).

NOTE: This is a basic test case.

--Name--
Extended code list

-- Definition --
Semantic analysis of the  extended elements of the code lists managed by the authorities of the MS /regions.  

--Description --
A semantic comparison of the extended code list values have to establish the relation between the extended values and the values included in the LCM. 
When "narrower" extensions are allowed the new values can restrict the semantic meaning of a value within the same code list of the LCM. The mapping between the original and extended value shall be provided.
When "any" extension is allowed that extended values must avoid semantic clashes with the values already defined in the LCM .

NOTE 1. When "any" extension is allowed, "narrower" code list elements can be introduced too.

NOTE 2. When notification about the extension to the Commission applies, consistency between the schema and the notification shall be preserved. 

NOTE 3. This is a capability test case.

--Name--
Encoding

--Definition --
Encoding applicable for data exchange within LPISQA.

-- Description --
The xml/gml schema should follow the standard specified by DG JRC. 

NOTE. This is a capability test case.

comment.en: A Line is a LineString with exactly 2 Points.

A MultiPolygon is a MultiSurface whose elements are Polygons.
The assertions for MultiPolygons are as follows.
a) The interiors of 2 Polygons that are elements of a MultiPolygon may not intersect.
b) The boundaries of any 2 Polygons that are elements of a MultiPolygon may not cross and may touch at only a finite number of Points.
c) A MultiPolygon is defined as topologically closed.
d) A MultiPolygon may not have cut lines, spikes or punctures, a MultiPolygon is a regular closed Point set,
e) The interior of a MultiPolygon with more than 1 Polygon is not connected; the number of connected components of the interior of a MultiPolygon is equal to the number of Polygons in the MultiPolygon. 
The boundary of a MultiPolygon is a set of closed Curves (LineStrings) corresponding to the boundaries of its element Polygons. Each Curve in the boundary of the MultiPolygon is in the boundary of exactly 1 element Polygon, and every Curve in the boundary of an element Polygon is in the boundary of the MultiPolygon.

definition.value: A set of concepts, optionally including statements about semantic relationships between those concepts.

scopeNote.value: A concept scheme may be defined to include concepts from different sources.

example.value: Thesauri, classification schemes, subject heading lists, taxonomies, 'folksonomies', and other types of controlled vocabulary are all examples of concept schemes. Concept schemes are also embedded in glossaries and terminologies.

--Name--

Types of EFA as listed in Art. 46(2) of (EU) R 1307/2013.

-- Description --
MS shall decide that one or more values of this code list  are considered to be ecological focus area.

NOTE 1: Member States may decide to limit the selection of landscape features to those under GAEC 7, SMR 2 or SMR 3  as referred to in Annex II to Regulation (EU) No 640/2013 and/or to one or more of those listed in point (a) to (h) of the first subparagraph, where duly justified. Should it be the case, the code list of EFA types have to be modifie accordingly.

NOTE 2: The extension of this code list shall be documented in the eligibility profile of the MS/region. It is recommended to use  a register / registry service to publish the extended values and their definitions.

NOTE 3: Landscape features shall be:
-at the disposal of the farmer;
-shall be those that are protected under GAEC 7, SMR 2 or SMR 3 as referred to in Annex II to Regulation (EU) No 640/2014.

List of possible real objects measured by an inspector.

NOTE
List may be extended or subtracted depending on how MS organizing on-the-spot check process.

-- Definition --
List of rules for cross-compliance
-- Description --
List of rules for cross-compliance. Rules for SMR and GAEC.

Sampling Strategy Type Value

List of sampling strategy types.

In accordance with Preamble (34) of R 809/2014 sampling should comprise a random part in order to obtain a representative error rate and a risk based part for the following Payment/support schemes:
	- greening payment
	- animal aid schemes
	- rural development measure

NOTE 1
To ensure a relevant and efficient risk analysis, the effectiveness of the risk analysis should be assessed and updated on an annual basis taking into account the relevance of each risk factor, comparing the results of randomly and risk-based selected samples and the specific situation [Preamble (68) and Art. 34(5) of R 809/2014].

NOTE 2
The sampling method should be selected and documented by the competent authority of the MS/Region. The values of the code list can be extended.

NOTE 3
The exemplary values of the code list in this application schema are taken from DSCG/2014/32 guideline and best statistical practices.

definition.value:
At least four crops

At least four crops present on the agricultural area. However, the main crop can cover maximum 75% of the area.

Issue
This value is listed twice in Annex IX as part of crop diversification and part of crop rotation. Since the conditions are the same and the same practice should not be "sold" twice, this  duplication seems to be redundant.

labels.en: National or regional environmental certification schemes

definition.value:
Specific crop varieties

Regional varieties of old, traditional or endangered crop types are included on at least 5 % of the rotated area.  In addition, three crops have to be present and the share of the main crop cannot exceed 75% of he agricultural area.

labels.en: National or regional environmental certification schemes

definition.value:
Ecological set aside

Equivalent practice that may be used for fulfilling the percentage requirements for EFA set in Art. 46(1) of R 1307/2013.

NOTE
The requirement is currently 5% of arable land.

labels.en: National or regional environmental certification schemes

definition.value:
Wildlife area management

Equivalent practice that may be used for fulfilling the percentage requirements for EFA set in Art. 46(1) of R 1307/2013.

Borders, in-field strips and patches managed for wildlife or specific fauna. It includes:
	- herbaceous border,
	- protection of nests,
	- wildflower strips,
	- local seed mix,
	- unharvested crops.

labels.en: National or regional environmental certification schemes

definition.value:
At least 3 crops with main crop less than 75%

At least three crops, the main crop covering less than the 75 % threshold

labels.en: Commitments undertaken in accordance with agri-environment-climate

definition.value:
Uncultivated buffer strips and field margins

Equivalent practice that may be used for fulfilling the percentage requirements for EFA set in Art. 46(1) of R 1307/2013.

Management of uncultivated buffer strips and field margins. It includes
	- cutting regime,
	- local or specified grass varieties and/or seeding regime,
	- re-seeding with regional varieties,
	- no use of pesticides,
	- no disposal of manure and/or mineral fertilisers,
	- no irrigation, 
	- no soil sealing.

labels.en: National or regional environmental certification schemes

definition.value:
Forage or hay evacuation

Maintenance of permanent grassland and evacuation of forage or hay.

labels.en: National or regional environmental certification schemes

definition.value:
Management of LF

Equivalent practice that may be used for fulfilling the percentage requirements for EFA set in Art. 46(1) of R 1307/2013.

The management includes following rules for pruning, trimming, dates, methods, restoration of landscape features (trees, hedgerows, riparian woody vegetation, stone walls (terraces), ditches, ponds).

labels.en: National or regional environmental certification schemes

definition.value:
High nature value buffer zone

Equivalent practice that may be used for fulfilling the percentage requirements for EFA set in Art. 46(1) of R 1307/2013.

The buffer zones are created for high nature value areas, Natura 2000 or other biodiversity protection sites, including along hedgerows and water courses.

labels.en: National or regional environmental certification schemes

definition.value:
Winter soil cover

Presence of winter soil cover.  In addition, three crops have to be present and the share of the main crop cannot exceed 75% of he agricultural area.

labels.en: National or regional environmental certification schemes

definition.value:
Pesticide Restrictions

Maintenance of permanent grassland and following pesticide restrictions.

labels.en: National or regional environmental certification schemes

definition.value:
PG and extensive grazing

Maintenance of permanent grassland and following extensive grazing (timing, maximum stocking density).

labels.en: National or regional environmental certification schemes

definition.value:
PG with LF and scrub control

Maintenance of permanent grassland and maintenance of landscape features on permanent grassland and control of scrub.

labels.en: National or regional environmental certification schemes

definition.value:
PG with grass varieties or seeding regime

Maintenance of permanent grassland  with specified grass varieties and/or seeding regime for renewal depending on the grassland type, with no destruction of high nature value.

labels.en: National or regional environmental certification schemes

definition.value:
Catch crop

Presence of catch crop.  In addition, three crops have to be present and the share of the main crop cannot exceed 75% of he agricultural area.

labels.en: National or regional environmental certification schemes

definition.value:
Specific production regime

Equivalent practice that may be used for fulfilling the percentage requirements for EFA set in Art. 46(1) of R 1307/2013.

It relates to production on arable land 
	- with no use of fertiliser (mineral fertiliser and manure) and/or plant protection products,
	- not irrigated,
	- not sown with the same crop two years in a row and on a fixed place.

Conversion into extensively used PG

Equivalent practice that may be used for fulfilling the percentage requirements for EFA set in Art. 46(1) of R 1307/2013.

It relates to conversion of arable land into permanent grassland extensively used.

labels.en: National or regional environmental certification schemes

definition.value:
Grass on arable peaty or wet soil

Equivalent practice that may be used for fulfilling the percentage requirements for EFA set in Art. 46(1) of R 1307/2013.

It relates to keeping arable peaty or wet soils under grass (with no use of fertilisers and no use of plant protection products).

labels.en: National or regional environmental certification schemes

definition.value:
More appropriate crop selection

More appropriate selection of crops, such as, for example, leguminous, protein crops, crops not requiring irrigation or pesticide treatments, etc. In addition, three crops have to be present and the share of the main crop cannot exceed 75% of he agricultural area.

labels.en: National or regional environmental certification schemes

definition.value:
OTSC sample

Sample from the entire population of applicants drawn by the authority responsible for the on-the-spot checks [Art. 59 (2) of R 1306/2013].

NOTE 1
In respect of certain rural development measures the on-the-spot check should cover also non-agricultural land. 

NOTE 2
In the interests of facilitating the implementation of the integrated system, it should be permitted to limit the actual measurement of the agricultural parcels to a random sample of 50 % of the agricultural parcels declared [Preamble 38 of R 809/2014].

--Name--
Agricultural area type value

-- Definition --
Types of agricultural area.

-- Description --
List of agricultural area type values.  QAF: Eligibility profile value.

NOTE 1:  According to DSCG/2014/33  arableLand, permanentCrop and permanetGrassland are the minimum level of details of land cover types needed for distinction of agricultural area.

NOTE 2:  sensitivePermanetGrassland type to be protected under greening  is required by Art.5(2)(d) of Regulation (EU) No 640/2014.

NOTE 3: This code list can be extended with narrower categories replacing the listed broader code list values. 

 

NOTE 4: For the purposes of ETS MS/Region may use the same code list applied in IACS, or a generalised one. For the purposes of ETS the generalised code list is sufficient.
When detailed  (crop level) agricultural area types are used, in course of MTS the mapping to the general categories listed in the LCM has to be given.

EXAMPLE: Sensitive permanent grassland may be replaced by any sub-category (narrower value) referred to in Art. 41 of (EU) R 639/2014.

label.en: List of agricultural area type values

definition.value:
--Name--
Permanent crop

-- Definition --
Non-rotational crops other than permanent grassland and permanent pasture that occupy the land for five years or more and yield repeated harvests, including nurseries and short rotation coppice. [Art. 4 (1)(g) of (EU) R No 1307/2013].

--Name--
Permanent grassland under established  local practices

-- Definition --
Permanent grassland under established local practices as referred to in Art.4(1)(h) of R (EU) No 1307/2013. 

-- Description --
Land which can be grazed and which forms part of established local practices where grasses and other herbaceous forage are traditionally not predominant in grazing areas.

NOTE: According to DSCG/2014/33  these areas should be added and identified in LPIS.

labels.en: Permanent grassland established under local practices

definition.value:
--Name--
Arable land

-- Definition --
Land cultivated for crop production or areas available for crop production but lying fallow, including areas set aside in accordance with Articles 22, 23 and 24 of Regulation (EC) No 1257/1999, with Article 39 of Regulation (EC) No 1698/2005 and with Article 28 of Regulation (EU) No 1305/2013, irrespective of whether or not that land is under greenhouses or under fixed or mobile cover.

--Name--
Permanent grassland

-- Definition --
Permanent grassland and permanent pasture (together referred to as "permanent grassland") means land used to grow grasses or other herbaceous forage naturally (self-seeded) or through cultivation (sown) and that has not been included in the crop rotation of the holding for five years or more; it may include other species such as shrubs and/or trees which can be grazed provided that the grasses and other herbaceous forage remain predominant as well as, where Member States so decide, land which can be grazed and which forms part of established local practices where grasses and other herbaceous forage are traditionally not predominant in grazing areas. [Art. 4(1)(g) 0f (EU) R No 1307/2013].

-- Definition --
Notification pattern weekly.
-- Description --
Notification pattern with weekly notification properties.

--Name--
Notification

-- Definition --
Notification to the EC services required by the CAP regulations.

-- Description --
Notifications are used to communicate information between MS and EC.

--Name--
Document citation

-- Definition --
Citation of any document that supports the CAP processes.

-- Description --
Citation for unambiguous referencing to a document.

EXAMPLE: URN, URL

Agricultural practice type value

List agricultural practices beneficial for the climate and the environment as detailed in Chapter 3 of R 1307/2013.

Agri-Environment and Climate Regulation Commitment

Equivalent practices that yield an equivalent or higher level of benefit for the climate and the environment [Art. 43(3)(a) of R 1307/2013]. 

The applicable regulations are the following:
	- Article 39(2) of Regulation (EC) No 1698/2005 (minimum requirements for fertiliser and plant protection product use) 
	- Article 28(2) of Regulation (EU) No 1305/2013

National or regional certification scheme

Equivalent practices that yield an equivalent or higher level of benefit for the climate and the environment [Art. 43(3)(b) of R 1307/2013]. 

The practices are included in Annex IX of this regulation and the AgriculturalEquivalentPracticeTypeValue code list of the Aid applications and payment claims application schema.

Maintaining existing permanent grassland

Agricultural practices beneficial for the climate and the environment [Art.43(2)(b) of R 1307/2013].

Crop diversification

Agricultural practices beneficial for the climate and the environment [Art.43(2)(a) of R 1307/2013].

Having ecological focus area on the agricultural area

Agricultural practices beneficial for the climate and the environment [Art.43(2)(c) of R 1307/2013].

labels.en: Having ecological focus area on the agricultural area

the population of relativeAreaCorrectness values defined for the following intervals: [-50%,<], [-50,-20%], [-20,-12%], [-12,-8%;], [-8,-4%,], [-4,-2%], [-2, 0%], [0, 2%], [2, 4%], [4, 8%], [8, 12%], [12, 20%], [20, 50%], [<50%]

--Name--
Data quality measure

--Definition --
Data quality measure is a descriptor of a data quality element used for evaluating data quality.

--Description --
In LPISQA specific data quality measures are used that are defined on the basis of data quality elements of ISO 19157:2013. The data quality measures are listed in the following code lists:
- DataQualityMeasureTypeIuiValue (for items under inspection)
- DataQualityMeasureTypeDTSValue (for LPIS as a whole)

comment.en: A Triangle is a polygon with 3 distinct, non-collinear vertices and no interior boundary.

definition.value:
Support scheme type value

List of support schemes as defined in Regulation (EU) 1307/2013.

NOTE
Payment schema type list may be extended or shortened by MS.

Voluntary coupled support

Member States may grant coupled support to farmers  for
	- cereals, 
	- oilseeds, 
	- protein crops, 
	- grain legumes, 
	- flax, 
	- hemp, 
	- rice, 
	- nuts, 
	- starch potato, 
	- milk and milk products, 
	- seeds, 
	- sheepmeat and goatmeat, 
	- beef and veal, 
	- olive oil, 
	- silkworms, 
	- dried fodder, 
	- hops, 
	- sugar beet, 
	- cane and chicory, 
	- fruit and vegetables and 
	- short rotation coppice.

NOTE
Details in Title IV, Chapter 1 of R 1307/2013.

Aegean islands

Chapter IV of Regulation (EU) No 229/2013 / Direct payments under measures established in the programmes: Specific measures in favour of the smaller Aegean islands.

Payment for agricultural practices beneficial for the climate and the environment 

Farmers entitled to a payment under the basic payment scheme or the single area payment scheme shall observe, on all their eligible hectares within the meaning of Article 32(2) to (5), the agricultural practices beneficial for the climate and the environment referred to in paragraph 2 of this Article or the equivalent practices referred to in paragraph 3 of this Article.

According to Title III, Chapter 3 of 1307/2013 Regulation  it is a decoupled payment. Also known as the Green Payment.

labels.en: Payment for agricultural practices beneficial for the climate and the environment

definition.value:
Redistributive payment

Conditional payment scheme decided by MS to grant an annual payment to farmers who are entitled to a payment under the basic payment scheme or under the single area payment scheme.

Art. 4 of Title III, Chapter 2 of R 1307/2013 sets the calculation method:
It shall be calculated 
	- each year by Member States
	- by multiplying a figure to be set by the Member State, which shall not be higher than 65 % of the national or regional average payment per hectare, by the number of payment entitlements or by the number of eligible hectares. 
The number of such payment entitlements or hectares shall not exceed a maximum to be set by Member States which shall not be higher than 30 hectares or the average size of agricultural holdings set out in Annex VIII if that average size exceeds 30 hectares in the Member State concerned.

NOTE
MS may establish a graduation in the number of hectares that is equally applied to every farmer.
-- Description --
Regulation / Decoupled payment.

Small farmers scheme

Member States may establish a scheme for small farmers in accordance with the conditions laid down in this Title.

According to Title V of 1307/2013 Regulation it is a decoupled payment.

Payment for areas with natural constraints

Payment to farmers who are entitled to BPS/SAPS and whose holdings are fully or partly situated in areas with natural constraints designated by Member States in accordance with Article 32(1) of Regulation (EU) No 1305/2013. 

NOTE
Rules in Title III, Chapter 4 of R 1307/2013

labels.en: Payment for areas with natural constraints

definition.value:
Crop-specific payment for cotton

Aid shall be granted to farmers producing cotton falling within CN code 5201 00 under the conditions laid down in this Chapter.

Title IV, Chapter 2 of 1307/2013 Regulation / Area payment.

Basic payment scheme

Basic payment scheme - BPS as described in Title III, Chapter 1, Sections 1, 2, 3 and 5 of Regulation (EU) 1307/2013.

Decoupled payment that is based on entitlements.

Payment for young farmers

Member States shall grant an annual payment to young farmers who are entitled to a payment under the basic payment scheme or the single area payment scheme referred to in Chapter 1.

According to Title III, Chapter 5 of 1307/2013 Regulation it is a decoupled payment.

Single area payment scheme 

Payment scheme based on the single area payment granted on an annual basis for each eligible hectare declared by the farmer in accordance with point (a) of the first subparagraph of Article 72(1) of Regulation (EU) No 1306/2013.

As described in Article 36 of 1307/2013 Regulation  it is a decoupled payment based on utilised land.

POSEI

Chapter IV of Regulation (EU) No 228/2013 / Direct payments under measures established in the programmes.

NOTE
In full: "Programme d'Options Spécifiques à l'Éloignement et l'Insularité".

Agricultural Equivalent Practice Type value

Values of equivalent agricultural practice types in sense of Art. 43(3)(a) and (b) of R 1307/2013.

label.en: List of agricultural equivalent practices requirements

definition.value:
National or regional certification scheme

Equivalent practices that yield an equivalent or higher level of benefit for the climate and the environment [Art. 43(3)(b) of R 1307/2013]. 

The details of practices together with the related requirements are included in Annex IX of this regulation and the AgriculturalEquivalentPracticeRequirementValue code list.

Agri-Environment and Climate Regulation Commitment

Equivalent practices that yield an equivalent or higher level of benefit for the climate and the environment [Art. 43(3)(a) of R 1307/2013]. 

The applicable regulations are the following:
	- Article 39(2) of Regulation (EC) No 1698/2005 (minimum requirements for fertiliser and plant protection product use) 
	- Article 28(2) of Regulation (EU) No 1305/2013

labels.en: Requirement: there are at least four crops

definition.value:
-- Definition --
Cross-checks.
-- Description --
Where appropriate, the administrative checks shall include cross-checks.

Control rate type value

List of applicable control rate values as prescribed by Art. 30, 31, 36(2) and 36(6) of R 809/2014.

NOTE
This code list currently does not contain values for rural development measures (Art. 32) and animal aid schemes (Art. 33 of R 809/2014).

label.en: List of control rate groups for greening

definition.value:
At least 10 % following greening practices by using environmental certification schemes

Increased control rate (5% normal+5% supplementary) in sense of Art. 31(3) for beneficiaries required to follow greening practices.

labels.en: At least 5 % of all beneficiaries required to observe the greening practices and using national or regional environmental certification schemes

definition.value:
At least 5% for the voluntary coupled support

In sense of Art. 30(e) of Regulation (EU) 809/2014 5% of beneficiaries applying for the voluntary coupled shall be controlled.

labels.en: At least 5% of all beneficiaries required to observe the agricultural practices having areas covered with permanent grasslands

definition.value:
At least 10 % of all beneficiaries participating in a regional implementation

Increased control rate (5% normal+5% supplementary) in sense of Art. 31(3) for beneficiaries required to follow greening practices.

labels.en: At least  5 % of all beneficiaries participating in a regional implementation

definition.value:
100% of mandatory reconversion into sensitive permanent grassland

In accordance with Art.31(1)(g) of R (EU) 809/2014 100 % of beneficiaries with an obligation to re-convert land into land under permanent grassland shall be controlled.

labels.en: 100 % of all beneficiaries with an obligation to re-convert land into land under permanent grassland, redistributive

definition.value:
At least 5 % of the collective implementation

In sensed of Art. 31(1)(e) od R EU) 809/2014 5 % of  the  collective implementation in accordance with Article 46(6) of Regulation (EU) No 1307/2013 shall be controlled.

labels.en: At least 5 % of  the  collective implementation

definition.value:
At least 5% for the redistributive payment

In sense of Art. 30(b) of Regulation (EU) 809/2014 5% of beneficiaries applying for the redistributive payment shall be controlled.

labels.en: At least 5% of all beneficiaries required to observe the agricultural practices having areas covered with permanent grasslands

definition.value:
At least 5% for the young farmers

In sense of Art. 30(d) of Regulation (EU) 809/2014 5% of beneficiaries applying for the young farmer payment shall be controlled.

labels.en: At least 5% of all beneficiaries required to observe the agricultural practices having areas covered with permanent grasslands

definition.value:
At least 3% or redistributive payment 

Art. 36(2) of Regulation (EU) 809/2014 allows the reduction of the control rate for redistributive payment from 5% to 3% when the cross checks based on geospatial applications are carried out.

labels.en: At least 5% of all beneficiaries required to observe the agricultural practices having areas covered with permanent grasslands

definition.value:
At least 3% of exempted from greening practices

In sense of Art. 31 (1)(b) at least 3 % of all beneficiaries qualifying for the greening payment who are exempted from both the crop diversification and the EFA obligations shall be controlled.

The exemption is granted when the thresholds referred to in Articles 44 and 46 of Regulation (EU) No 1307/2013 are not met and the obligations referred to in Article 45 of that Regulation are not concerned.

labels.en: At least 3 % of all beneficiaries qualifying for the greening payment who are exempted from both the crop diversification and the EFA obligations

definition.value:
At least 10% of the collective implementation

Increased control rate (5% normal+5% supplementary) in sense of Art. 31(3) for beneficiaries required to follow greening practices.

labels.en: At least 5 % of  the  collective implementation

definition.value:
At least 10% of areas covered by sensitive grassland

Increased control rate (5% normal+5% supplementary) in sense of Art. 31(3) for beneficiaries required to follow greening practices.

labels.en: At least 5% of all beneficiaries required to observe the agricultural practices having areas covered with permanent grasslands

definition.value:
At least 30% for production of hemp

In sense of Art. 30(g) of Regulation (EU) 809/2014 30% of beneficiaries declaring hemp shall be controlled.

NOTE
In accordance with art. 32(6) of R (EU) 1307/2013 only those varieties of hemp are eligible that have tetrahydrocannabinol content not exceeding 0,2 %.

labels.en: At least 5% of all beneficiaries required to observe the agricultural practices having areas covered with permanent grasslands

definition.value:
At least 20% for production of hemp

Art. 36(6) of Regulation (EU) 809/2014 allows the reduction of the control rate for production of hemp from 30% to 20% when a MS introduces a prior approval for the cultivation of hemp.

NOTE
MS shall notify the EC about the rules (or changes in the rules) of the approval system.

labels.en: At least 5% of all beneficiaries required to observe the agricultural practices having areas covered with permanent grasslands

definition.value:
At least 5 % of all beneficiaries participating in a regional implementation

In sense of Art.31(1)(d)  of R (EU) 809/2014 5 % of all beneficiaries participating in a regional implementation in accordance with Article 46(5) of Regulation (EU) No 1307/2013 shall be controlled.

labels.en: At least  5 % of all beneficiaries participating in a regional implementation

definition.value:
At least 5% of following greening practices

In sense of Art. 31(1) 5% of beneficiaries required to follow greening practices shall be controlled.

labels.en: At least 5% of all beneficiaries required to observe the agricultural practices having areas covered with permanent grasslands

definition.value:
At least 5 % following greening practices by using environmental certification schemes

In sense of Art. 31(1)(c) 5 % of beneficiaries observing greening practices and using national or regional environmental certification schemes as referred to in Article 43(3)(b) of Regulation (EU) No 1307/2013 shall be controlled.

labels.en: At least 5 % of all beneficiaries required to observe the greening practices and using national or regional environmental certification schemes

definition.value:
100 % of the contiguous structures of adjacent EFA

In sense of Art. 31(1)(f) of R (EU) 809/2014  100 % of the contiguous structures of adjacent ecological focus areas as referred to in Article 46(5) of Regulation (EU) 1307/2013 shall be controlled.

labels.en: 100 % of the contiguous structures of adjacent ecological focus areas

definition.value:
At least 5% for BPS or SAPS

In sense of Art. 30(a) of Regulation (EU) 809/2014 5% of beneficiaries applying for the basic payment or single area payment scheme shall be controlled.

This control sample shall contain at least 5 % of all beneficiaries declaring mainly agricultural areas which are areas naturally kept in a state suitable for grazing in accordance with Article 10(1) of Delegated Regulation (EU) No 639/2014.

labels.en: At least 5% of all beneficiaries required to observe the agricultural practices having areas covered with permanent grasslands

definition.value:
At least 10% of following greening practices

Increased control rate (5% normal+5% supplementary) in sense of Art. 31(3) of R 809/2014 for beneficiaries required to follow greening practices. 

Where the ecological focus areas are not identified in the identification system for agricultural parcels as referred to in Article 70 of Regulation (EU) No 1306/2013, the control rate laid down in points (a) and (c) to (e) of paragraph 1 shall be supplemented by 5% of all beneficiaries of the respective control sample who are required to have ecological focus area on the agricultural area in accordance with Articles 43 and 46 of Regulation (EU) No 1307/2013.

labels.en: At least 5% of all beneficiaries required to observe the agricultural practices having areas covered with permanent grasslands

definition.value:
At least 5% for crop specific cotton payment

In sense of Art. 30(h) of Regulation (EU) 809/2014 5% of beneficiaries applying for the crop specific payment for cotton shall be controlled.

labels.en: At least 5% of all beneficiaries required to observe the agricultural practices having areas covered with permanent grasslands

definition.value:
At least 3% for small farmer scheme

Art. 36(2) of Regulation (EU) 809/2014 allows the reduction of the control rate for the small farmer scheme  from 5% to 3% when the cross checks based on geospatial applications are carried out.

labels.en: At least 5% of all beneficiaries required to observe the agricultural practices having areas covered with permanent grasslands

definition.value:
At least 5% for areas with natural constraints 

In sense of Art. 30(c) of Regulation (EU) 809/2014 5% of beneficiaries applying for the payment for areas with natural constraints shall be controlled.

labels.en: At least 5% of all beneficiaries required to observe the agricultural practices having areas covered with permanent grasslands

definition.value:
At least 5% of areas covered by sensitive grassland

The greenling sample in sense of Art. 31(1) of R (EU) 809/2014 shall cover at least 5 % of all beneficiaries having areas covered with permanent grasslands which are environmentally sensitive in areas covered by Council Directive 92/43/EEC[18] or Directive 2009/147/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council[19] and further sensitive areas referred to in Article 45(1) of Regulation (EU) No 1307/2013.

labels.en: At least 5% of all beneficiaries required to observe the agricultural practices having areas covered with permanent grasslands

definition.value:
At least 3% for BPS or SAPS

Art. 36(2) of Regulation (EU) 809/2014 allows the reduction of the control rate for BPS/SAPS from 5% to 3% when the cross checks based on geospatial applications are carried out.

labels.en: At least 5% of all beneficiaries required to observe the agricultural practices having areas covered with permanent grasslands

definition.value:
At least 20% of mandatory reconversion into permanent grassland

In sense of Art. 31(1)(h) of R (EU) 809/2014 20 % of all beneficiaries with an obligation to re-convert land into permanent grassland shall be controlled.

labels.en: 100 % of all beneficiaries with an obligation to re-convert land into land under permanent grassland, redistributive

definition.value:
At least 5% for the small farmer scheme

In sense of Art. 30(f) of Regulation (EU) 809/2014 5% of beneficiaries applying for the small farmer scheme shall be controlled.

labels.en: At least 5% of all beneficiaries required to observe the agricultural practices having areas covered with permanent grasslands

definition.value:
--Name--
Conversion parameter

-- Definition --
Conversion and weighting factors  for calculating EFA  area referred to in Art 46(3) of (EU) R No 1307/2013.

-- Description --
Conversion factors needed for calculating the converted area of EFA based on spatial representation with reduced dimensions (point, curve) and the weighting factor expressing the ecological weight of EFA.

label.en: Conversion parameters for ecological focus area

description.en:
The class represents the top-level geometry type. This class is 
      equivalent to the UML class GM_Object defined in ISO 19107, and 
      it is superclass of all geometry types.

definition.value:
-- Name--
Conformance test report

--Definition --
Summary of the conformance to the standard as well as all the details of the testing that supports the given overall summary [ISO19105].

-- Description --
The results of conformance testing shall be documented in a conformance test report. This report shall be in two parts: one summary and one with detailed information. A pro forma shall be used to produce each conformance test report. The first part shall be an overall summary of the conformance status of the IUT. It shall provide an overview of the verdicts that are assigned to the test cases executed in the conformance assessment process. The second part shall document all of the results of the executable test cases, referencing to the conformance log which contains the observed test outcomes. It shall reference all necessary documents relating to the conduct of the conformance assessment process for that standard.

--Name--
Observed area

-- Definition --
Totality of  the areas of all eligible land cover types within the parcel.

-- Description --
This area value comprises the sum of areas of eligible agricultural land  and landscape features contained within the item under inspection. The minimum condition for assigning a value for this attribute is the existence of one eligible agricultural land cover type within the item under inspection.

NOTE 1: By definition, a stand-alone LF (i.e. LF without agricultural land) does not constitute agricultural land. If a RP does not contain agricultural land, it is a critical defect.

NOTE 2: The unit of meaurement shall be m2.
/* Value of observedArea shall be given in square meters. */

definition.value:
Minimum risk based sample size

Theoretical minimum population of the sample size selected on risk basis.

NOTE 1
This property has to be recorded for green payments only. The risk based population should stay between the indicated minimum and maximum.

NOTE 2
The minimum population of the risk based size of a sample has to be calculated as product of the control rate and the associated risk based part.

EXAMPLE:
For green payments the minimum risk based part is 75 % out of the 5% control population; i.e. 3,75% all together.

definition.value: skos:broaderTransitive is a transitive superproperty of skos:broader.

scopeNote.value: By convention, skos:broaderTransitive is not used to make assertions. Rather, the properties can be used to draw inferences about the transitive closure of the hierarchical relation, which is useful e.g. when implementing a simple query expansion algorithm in a search application.

Relates two concepts coming, by convention, from different schemes, and that have comparable meanings

comment.en: These concept mapping relations mirror semantic relations, and the data model defined below is similar (with the exception of skos:exactMatch) to the data model defined for semantic relations. A distinct vocabulary is provided for concept mapping relations, to provide a convenient way to differentiate links within a concept scheme from links between concept schemes. However, this pattern of usage is not a formal requirement of the SKOS data model, and relies on informal definitions of best practice.

definition.value:
-- Definition --
Correspondent description.
-- Description --
Identification of, and means of communication with, person(s) and organisations associated with the dataset.

--Name--
Support schema type

-- Definition --
Support schema type as defined in Annex I of Regulation  (EU) 1307/2013.

-- Description --
The maximum eligible area for a given reference parcel (i.e. the reference area value) used for the automatic crosscheck of the farmer‘s application depends on the support scheme. It is necessary therefore to indicate the support scheme, for which a specific area value is valid.

NOTE. Currently in this model version only maximum 11 schemas have placeholders.

--Name--
Number of measured items

--Definition --
Number of items under inspection for which the delineation of land cover was feasible.

-- Description --
The items under inspection can correspond to single or aggregated parcels. A set of aggregated parcels counts as 1 item.

NOTE. Number of Measured parcels shall not be less than 200.

--Name--
Area non-conformance cause

-- Definition --
Statement of the technical cause(s) leading to non-conformance in terms of the observed area of the item under inspection.

-- Description --
The technical reason shall be assigned from the following list:
- missed  update
- missed upgrade
- incomplete processing
- processing error
- incompatible design

NOTE: One or more technical reason value selected from the TechnicalReasonValue enumeration.

--Name--
Certification body description

-- Description --
A certification body establishes well defined criteria for issuing a certificate, and issues certificates based upon the test report produced by testing laboratories. A certification body should exist in each country which has a conformance testing service operating. Mutual recognition of test results is ensured by adoption of the same criteria by certification bodies worldwide. The function of the certification body may be performed by the accreditation body, in which case no separate certification body is necessary.
IXIT typically provides the details on the organization and storage of concepts in the SUT as well as on the means
of access to and modification of the SUT

Inspection method

-- Definition --
Method applied for the quality assessment process.

-- Description --
The value shall be selected from the InspecionMethodValue code list before the inspection starts. The selected method shall be applied to all inspected items. Changing the inspection method from item to item is forbidden.

NOTE: MS/Region have the opportunity to change the inspection method from year to year. The selected method shall be reported together with the PointZeroState file.

Sampling parameter (index) necessary for the definition of the acceptance values as function of a given sample size. 

-- Description --
Limiting quality value shall be taken from the  corresponding enumeration. LQ applied for critical defects shall be 2,00. For any other conformance result LQ shall be 12,50.

definition.value:
-- Definition --
Template document citation.
-- Description --
URL.

Control rate type

Control rate types as prescribed by Art. 30, 31, 36(2) and 36(6) of R 809/2014.

--Name--
Non-structured evidence document

-- Definition --
Any record that supports  or documents the decisions made during the inspection process.

-- Description --
EXAMPLES: description, sketch, photo, document, additional measurement data, etc.

Maximum risk based sample size

Theoretical maximum population of the sample size selected on risk basis.

NOTE 1
This property has to be recorded for green payments only. The risk based population should stay between the indicated minimum and maximum.

NOTE 2
The maximum population of the risk based size of a sample has to be calculated as product of the control rate and the associated risk based part.

EXAMPLE:
For green payments the maximum risk based part is 80 % out of the 5% control population; i.e. 4% all together.

--Name--
Parcel aggregation

-- Definition --
Substitution of the single parcel targeted for inspection by an inspection item formed by the aggregation of reference parcels that represent the extension of agricultural land covering this single parcel.

-- Description --
This method is mostly relevant to the LPIS based on cadastral and agricultural parcels. When a boundary section of the RP  cannot be measures because it is invisible, the item under inspection shall be extended till the visible  boundaries of each LC types present in the parcel. All observations and measurement shall be performed for this extended parcel, which is, in fact, and aggregate of parcels. The IDs of parcels that enter in aggregation shall be noted in the ETS observation report.

NOTE: Parcel aggregation is frequently applicable for LPIS based on cadastral or agricultural parcels, but must be considered by all designs.

-- Definition --
Any citation that supports the application process.
-- Description --
URL.

On-the-spot check date

Date of when on-the-spot check was performed.

NOTE 1
According to Art. 59(4) of R 1306/2013 and Art. 26(1) of R 809/2014 when appropriate agricultural aid and rural development support shall be carried out at the same time.

NOTE 2
On-the-spot checks should be carried out in the calendar year in which the relevant aid applications and payment claims have been submitted [Preamble (71) of R 809/2014].

NOTE 3
Where certain eligibility criteria, commitments and other obligations can only be checked during a specific time period, the on-the-spot checks may require additional visits at a later date [Art. 26(4) of R 809/2014].

definition.value:
--Name--
Oversampling parameter.

-- Definition --
Extent of oversampling due to the difference between acceptance numbers prescribed by the indexes LQ=2.00 and LQ=12.50.

--Description --
For decisions based on LQ=12.50 the prescribed sample size is 200. However a number of items prescribed by LQ=2.00 is inspected and measured (oversampling). This parameter shows how the actual and sufficient population relate to one another.  

EXAMPLE. The sample size for LQ=2.00 is 1250 items. They have been inspected. Out of these items 1115 have been measured. The oversampling parameter will be defined proportionally (1115/200=5,575). It means that out of the measured items 100 (5,575x18=100,35 truncated) can be non-conforming.

NOTE: the prescribed sample size and acceptance number for LQ=2.00 test are NOT subject to proportional adaptation. I.e. only the first 500, 800 or 1250 inspected items are evaluated against an invariant acceptance number of 18.

OTSC report

According to Art. 24(3) of R 809/2014 the results of the [...OTSC] shall be assessed to establish whether any problems encountered could in general entail a risk for other similar operations, beneficiaries or other bodies. The assessment shall also identify the causes of such situations, any further examination which may be required and necessary corrective and preventive actions. This analysis is an important input for risk analysis of the next campaign year.
skos:narrowerTransitive is a transitive superproperty of skos:narrower.

scopeNote.value: By convention, skos:narrowerTransitive is not used to make assertions. Rather, the properties can be used to draw inferences about the transitive closure of the hierarchical relation, which is useful e.g. when implementing a simple query expansion algorithm in a search application.

--Name--
MTS report

-- Definition --

-- Description --

Element name

--Definition--
Name of the data quality element for which quality is reported.

--Description--

The data quality elements corresponding to the data quality measures are listed in the description of the specific DQM.

Inspectors Survey Object Type Value

Types of real world objects observed/measured by inspector.

Risk type

Type of the risk established by the competent authority for which the application has been selected for on-the-spot check.

The competent authority should establish the risk factors targeting the areas where the risk of errors is the highest. To ensure relevant and efficient risk analysis, the effectiveness of the risk criteria should be assessed and updated on an annual basis taking into account the relevance of each risk criterion, comparing the results of randomly and risk-based selected samples, the specific situation in the Member States and the nature of the non-compliance (Preamble (30) of R (EU) No 809/2014)

NOTE
According to Art. 34(6) of Regulation (EU) No 809/2014 the competent authority shall keep records of the reasons for the selection of each beneficiary for an on-the-spot check. The inspector carrying out the on-the-spot check shall be informed accordingly prior to the commencement of the on-the-spot check.

-- Definition --

-- Description --
The administrative checks referred to in Article 74 of Regulation (EU) No 1306/2013, including cross-checks, shall permit the detection of non-compliances, in particular the automated detection using computerised means. The checks shall cover all elements that are possible and appropriate to control by means of administrative checks. definition.value:
-- Definition --
Notification group.
-- Description --
Notification group to which notification pattern belongs.

-- Definition --
Estimated absolute positional accuracy.
-- Description --
Estimated absolute positional accuracy of the object measured in the used coordinate reference system. Absolute positional accuracy is the mean value of the positional uncertainties for a set of positions, where the positional uncertainties are the distance between a measured position and what is considered as the corresponding true position. This mean value may come from quality measures on a homogeneous population of objects measured or from an estimation based on the knowledge of the production processes and of their accuracy.

--Name--
Supplementary data

-- Definition --
Reference to the data source evaluated as fit for update.

-- Description --
Data selected for resolving an anomaly. It can be one or more dataset, imagery, measurement vectors, etc. They should be referred to in the documentation of the anomaly. The reference is provided as specified in the SupplementaryDocumentation data type of the BaseTypes application schema.

--Name--
Subject for collective implementation

-- Definition --
Indication whether the EFA instance is subject for collective implementation as referred to in Art. 46(6) of (EU) R 1307/2013.

-- Description --
Collective implementation is allowed when:
- the holdings of farmers concerned are in close proximity;
- the ecological focus areas concerned are contiguous.
In order to underpin the implementation of Union policies on the environment, climate and biodiversity, Member States may designate the areas on which collective implementation is possible and may impose further obligations upon farmers or groups of farmers participating in such collective implementation.

NOTE: Aspect of collective implementation:
- If EFA is fully situated within or adjacent to arable land within one application then EFA is not subject to collective implementation.
- If EFA situated on or adjacent to arable land and covered by several applications - is subject to collective implementation.
- If subjectToCollectiveImplementation = TRUE then EFA must be contiguous.

-- Definition --

Feature-level metadata is attributes on a feature and is used to store metadata about the feature.

--Name--
Congruency test

-- Definition --
Conformance statement in the result of the congruency test.

-- Description --
"Congruent" refers to a situation where two polygons (parcel representations) have the same shape and dimension. This condition is fulfilled when
- the position of the two geometric representations coincide, or
- there is no coincidence between the geometric representations, but the shape and the dimension is the same. In fact, in this cases there is a shift between the two geometries.

-- Definition --
Activity on site.
-- Description --
The whole area and all infrastructures included on it, covering the same or different  "sites", under the control  of an operator to perform  agricultural or aquaculture activities. The holding includes one specialisation of ActivityComplex, ie. Activity. the values of ActivityType are expressed conform the classification of the economic activity of the holding, according to the NACE rev. 2.0 coding. Holding is a thematic extension of the generic Class “Activity Complex” shared with other thematic areas describing entities related with Economical Activities (Legal Entity Class – Business).
NOTE. Accessible at Eurostat repository from URL http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/ramon/nomenclatures/index.cfm?TargetUrl=LST_CLS_DLD&StrNom=NACE_REV2&StrLanguageCode=EN&StrLayoutCode=HIERARCHIC. 
NOTE. At least one of the function attributes of the Holding spatial object shall be provided using the EconomicActivityNACEValue code list (for the activity attribute of the Function data type).

--Name--
Reference area

-- Definition --
Value for the quantification of area as referred to in Art. 5(3) of (EU) R 640/2014.

-- Description --
Officially known area of reference  parcel in hectare, which corresponds to the maximum area, for which an application can be made.

NOTE 1:  Reference area value shall be expressed in hectares.
/* Value of referenceArea shall be given in hectars. */
inv: self.referenceArea.uom.uomSymbol='ha'

NOTE 2: Reference area equals to MEA under BPS/SAPS [DSCG/2014/33]. For other payments schemes (e.g. voluntary coupled support) other MEA values may apply. Currently Annex I of regulation 1307/2013 define 11 support schema types.

NOTE 3: When no pro-rata applies , the reference area corresponds to the geometric area within the 2% stability margin.

NOTE 4:  Area reductions are subject of applying pro-rata system, or applying the  100 sq.m  limit for cumulative area of ineligible features of the same type.

NOTE 5: It is not necessary to deduct the area of a non agricultural area LC type when it is smaller than 100 sq.m.. However, in course of LPISQA or OTSC, when the cumulative area (per type) of such smaller features is more, the deduction shall be applied.

NOTE 6: Pro-rata shall be applied to "clean", homogenous LC  (E.g. after all ineligible features are excluded).
