-- Definition --
Final area determined after all administrative checks.
-- Description --
If AdministrativeCheck.determinedArea<>Application.declaredArea Then
AdministrativeCheck.determinedArea = AdministrativeCheck.determinedArea Else
AdministrativeCheck.determinedArea = Application.declaredArea
EndIf

label.en: Final area determined after all administrative checks

definition.value:
--Name--
Value type

--Definition--
Value type is the data type used for reporting the result of the measure. The data types defined in ISO/TS 19103:2005 shall be used. 

--Description--
For purposes of LPISQA the following data types are used:
- Primitive types: CharacterString, Integer, Real, Boolean
- Collections: Sequence, matrix

NOTE: Section 7 of ISO/TS 19103:2005 provides and overview of the applicable core data types.

--Name--
Number of missed updates

-- Definition --
Abundance of missed updates within the sample as technical cause for critical defects and non-conformances.

--Description --
Occurrences of missedUpdate value assigned to the items under inspection within the sample. It comprises values of misclassificationCause, criticalDefectCasue, contaminationCause, and areaNonConformityCause.
The scope of this data quality element are the above listed properties. 

NOTE. Previously known as part of Abundance for the causes for occurrence of non-conforming reference parcels, or 10204 LPIS_RP_CEA.

--Name--
Feasibility for measurement

-- Definition --
Usability (fitness for purpose) of the input vector and imagery data to quantify the area of each eligible land cover type present in the inspected item.

-- Description --
Area measurement of the item under inspection is feasible on imagery when its whole territory is free of cloud, haze and any other phenomenon that prevents the observation of its boundaries and interior.  The input vector data (LPIS) is fit for the purpose when it unambiguously defines the geometric extent of the item under inspection. In case of field measurements it comprises the necessary conditions for field measurement (unobscured visibility along the perimeter, absence of force major reason (e.g. land slide at a boundary section).

NOTE 1. If measurement is not feasible (feasibilityForMeasurement=false) then only values for itemCriticalDefectConformance and ItemConformance DQM should be defined in dataQualityMeasureType.

NOTE 2: In ETS 5.3 this measure was named 10101 RP_FSM.

-- Definition --
Any document that supports the administrative check.
-- Description --
In respect of animal aid schemes and animal-related support measures, Member States may, where appropriate, make use of evidence received from other services, bodies or organisations to verify the compliance with the eligibility criteria, commitments and other obligations, provided that the service, body or organisation in question is operating to a standard sufficient to control such compliance.
NOTE. If the aid application or payment claim is complete and submitted within the relevant time-limit and, where applicable, the supporting documents (that prove eligibility) must be submitted.

--Name--
Declared area

-- Definition --
Area declared by the farmer for the given reference parcel for the assessment year.

--Description--
The value of declared area is taken from the aid application register of IACS IACS for the assessment year.

NOTE 1. In our conceptual model this is the value of areaDeclared attribute. 

NOTE 2. The area value shall be given in hectares.

--Name--
Data quality measure description

-- Definition --
This is a placeholder only; currently not to be implemented.

Description of particular data quality measure.

-- Description --
Extended description of data quality measure.
NOTE. Depends on selected dataQualityMeasureType.

-- Definition --
Cross-compliance rule description.
-- Description --. 
Descriptions must be provided by Member States and communicated with EC via notifications.

--Name--
Waivered

-- Definition --
Immunity that vindicates a physical contamination to cause non-conformance of the item under inspection.

-- Description --
A waiver can be applied when the following conditions are met:
- the usability of the parcel remains intact;
- the deviation from the generic rule stems from the semantic definition of the LPIS;
- the waiver has been created and approved before the inspection starts.

EXAMPLE: A road crosscutting an RP in an LPIS based on topographic blocks or cadastral parcels can be waivered. NB: the area the road shall always be deducted from the reference area.

Supplementary control rate

The control rates prescribed by Art. 30 and Art.31 of Regulation (EU) 809/2014 should be increased in two cases:

1. In sense of Art. 31(3) of R (EU) 809/2014 when instances of EFA are not included in LPIS, the control rate for the following green payments have to be increased by 5 % for the following beneficiaries:
	- beneficiaries required to observe greening practices
	- beneficiaries observing greening by using national/regional certification schemes
	- beneficiaries participating in collective implementation
	- beneficiaries participating in regional implementation

2. In sense of Art. 35 of R(EU) 809/2014  when the OTSC reveal any significant non-compliance in a (part of a) region or a specific aid scheme or support measure.

NOTE. Land cover classes with different pro-rata coefficients constitute separate land cover classes.

Random or risk based selection in sense of Preamble (68) and Art. 34(5) of R 809/2014.

Some possible narrower values are listed in the SamplingStrategyTypeValue code list. Specifying narrower categories of risk based and random sampling is justified to provide input for the OTSC report and risk analysis in the next campaign year.

definition.value:
-- Definition --
Entitlement reserve source.
-- Description --
Item description.
NOTE 1. Item note.
EXAMPLE 1. Item example.

-- Definition --
There is no double financing through other Union schemes.
-- Description --
The administrative checks referred to in Article 74 of Regulation (EU) No 1306/2013, including cross-checks, shall permit the detection of non-compliances, in particular the automated detection using computerised means. The checks shall cover all elements that are possible and appropriate to control by means of administrative checks. They shall ensure that: there is no double financing through other Union schemes.

label.en: There is no double financing through other Union schemes

-- Definition --
The aid application or payment claim is complete.
-- Description --
The administrative checks referred to in Article 74 of Regulation (EU) No 1306/2013, including cross-checks, shall permit the detection of non-compliances, in particular the automated detection using computerised means. The checks shall cover all elements that are possible and appropriate to control by means of administrative checks. They shall ensure that: the aid application or payment claim is complete and submitted within the relevant time-limit and, where applicable, that supporting documents have been submitted and that they prove eligibility.

label.en: The aid application or payment claim is complete

definition.value:
Estimated Positional Accuracy

Estimated absolute positional accuracy of the object measured in the used coordinate reference system. Absolute positional accuracy is the mean value of the positional uncertainties for a set of positions, where the positional uncertainties are the distance between a measured position and what is considered as the corresponding true position. This mean value may come from quality measures on a homogeneous population of objects measured or from an estimation based on the knowledge of the production processes and of their accuracy.

definition.value:
--Name--
Abstract test type

-- Definition --
Reference to the abstract test case for which the executable test case(s) is (are) performed.

-- Description --
The values of this attribute shall come from the TestTypeMtsValue code list. To one abstract test case at least one executable test case shall correspond.

--Name--
Reference parcel ID

-- Definition --
Unique thematic ID of the affected reference parcel(s) where the anomaly has been observed.

-- Description --
This parcel is the main subject of further investigation. With registering an anomaly the parcel concerned enters in another state of the life cycle (under evaluation).

NOTE. An anomaly, for example erroneous boundary position, may affect more than the parcel that has been the subject of inspection. When this is the case, the neighbouring affected parcels need to get involved in the update process.

--Name--
Data quality measure type

-- Definition --
List of data quality measures applied in LPISQA.

-- Description --
Data Quality measures shall be selected from DataQualityMeasureTypeIuiValue.

--Name--
Mandated area ID

-- Definition --
Unique thematic ID of mandated area within region of ecological focus area.

-- Description --
Nation-wide unique alphanumerical identification code of mandated area within region of ecological focus area.

label.en: Unique thematic ID of mandated area within region of ecological focus area

definition.value:
--Name--
LPIS lot size

-- Definition --
Number of items in a lot [ISO 2859-1:1999].

-- Description --
It is the number of reference parcels within the LPIS lot.

--Name--
Status of anomaly 

-- Definition --
Status of the life -cycle of anomaly defined in terms of the related code list.

-- Description --
The values of this attributes are taken from the StatusOfAnomaly code list. 

NOTE. This code list is a shortened one as compared to the states listed in the State machine diagram.

--Name--
Conversion factor

-- Definition --
Parameter in sense of Art. 43(3) of R (EU) 1307/2013  used for calculating the total hectares represented by the ecological focus area.

--Description--
The conversion factor is used by simplified geometric representation of EFA (point or curve) in order to arrive area values.

NOTE
Conversion factor is not applicable when EFA are represented by surfaces (GM_Surface).

-- Definition --
Any citation that supports the administrative check.
-- Description --
In respect of animal aid schemes and animal-related support measures, Member States may, where appropriate, make use of evidence received from other services, bodies or organisations to verify the compliance with the eligibility criteria, commitments and other obligations, provided that the service, body or organisation in question is operating to a standard sufficient to control such compliance.
NOTE. If the aid application or payment claim is complete and submitted within the relevant time-limit and, where applicable, the supporting documents (that prove eligibility) must be submitted.

-- Definition --
Unique thematic ID of a payment entitlement.
-- Description --
Thematic identifier at national level, generally the full national code of the payment entitlement.

label.en: Unique thematic ID of a payment entitlement

definition.value:
--Name--
Parameter value

-- Definition --
Value of parameter(s) needed to perform the executable test.

-- Description --
Executable test cases result from the instantiation of specific values for parameters in an abstract test case. Parameters are most frequently used in testing conformity with constraints. 

EXAMPLE. The width values of LF/EFA elements are parameters to be used in testing conceptual consistency through a constraint.

--Name--
Conformance log

--Definition--
Results of the executable test cases, referencing to the conformance log.

--Description--
Second part of report. The second part shall document all of the results of the executable test cases, referencing to the conformance log which contains the observed test outcomes. It shall reference all necessary documents relating to the conduct of the conformance assessment process for that standard / legal document.

label.en: Results of the executable test cases, referencing to the conformance log

definition.value:
-- Definition --
Repetitive notification.
-- Description --
Repetitive notification.

--Name--
Feasibility for inspection

-- Definition --
Correctness, completeness, and usability of input data  as well as physical conditions that allow observations necessary for quality assessment.

-- Description --
Regardless of the inspection methodology the input and source data should be correct and complete and no force major conditions should prevent the inspection process. In addition, for CAPI inspection feasibility for inspection  also depends on the usability and the  completeness of the orthoimagery coverage.  

NOTE: When inspection is not feasible, the preventing reason shall be documented using the values of the SkippingReasonTypeValue code list.

Into sensitive permanent grassland

Possible values of reconverting obligation.

NOTE
IntoPermanentGrassland  and the IntoSensitivePermanentGrassland are mutually exclusive values.

--Name--
Contamination cause

-- Definition --
Technical reason that has presumably caused  the contamination.

-- Description --
Technical reason shall be selected from the TechnicalReasonValue code list.

NOTE. Contamination cause shall be given when value of waivered is FALSE.

--Name--
Metadata

-- Definition --
Feature-level metadata are attributes of a feature type that is used to store auxiliary information about the data record belonging to that type

-- Description --
Feature level metadata can include information about the life-cycle, status, data quality, usability, responsible entity, etc.

Conformance statement

Verdict based on the outcome of the on-the-spot check whether the rules, eligibility criteria, commitments and other obligations relating to the conditions for the granting of support have been met.

On-the-spot checks shall verify the accuracy of the data declared by the beneficiary against underlying documents. This includes a verification that the payment claims submitted by the beneficiary are supported by accounting or other documents, including, where necessary, a check on the accuracy of the data in the payment claim on the basis of data or commercial documents held by third parties. On-the-spot checks shall verify that the use or intended use of the operation is consistent with the use described in the application for support and for which the support was granted. Except in exceptional circumstances, duly recorded and explained by the competent authorities, on-the-spot checks shall include a visit to the place where the operation is implemented or, if the operation is intangible, to the operation promoter. 
	
EXAMPLE.
Aid application or payment claim shall be rejected if the beneficiary or his representative prevents an on-the-spot check from being carried out, except in cases of force majeure or in exceptional circumstances. In this case (if it is not force majeure or exceptional circumstance)

label.en: On the spot check conformance statement
